text: Pours red, clear, small head. Cherries, vanilla, wood, yeast, sour, basement, red fruits, perfect aroma. Dry, sour, crisp. Full body, nice carbonation. Exceptional

Vynikající styl piva s ovocností a silným řízem, aromatem i pěnou. Vynikající.
Tóny: červené víno, hrozny. Alkoholový nádech, jemnějí chmelovost.

W aromacie i smaku wiśnie, maliny, czereśnie, czerwone wino, trochę nalewki wiśniowej, bretty. Słodko-kwaśne z naciskiem na słodycz. Pijalność średnia, w wyglądzie czerwone z przyzwoitą kremową pianą. Dobry flanders, choć może nieco zbyt słodki

Tap @Mikkeller, Viktoriagade. Nearly clear red amber, thick and slightly pinkish head. Aroma has lots of sour, red berries. Sweetish, slightly acetic flavour, light acetone. Sweet red berries. Lovely. My 500th rating this month, think Ill give it a break now. Nah... just one more...

Aroma: vinegar (intense but not so intense as in Rodenbach Vintage or Duchesse de Bourgogne), red sour fruits notes.
Taste and flavour: sour, vinegar, red fruits.
Medium-high carbonation, but it is very pleasant here.
Pretty color - mix of red and pink.

Pours a redish brown body with a very thin head. Fruity aroma. Taste is rich and complex with a nice fruityness and subtle sourness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle.
Ruby red, hazy, small head with nice lacing. Aroma: raspberry, sugar, wine. Taste: sour, vinegar, raspberry and other berries, tart, sweet finish. Medium body. Medium plus carbo.

Shared bottle at Cardinal, Stavanger. 2013 Edition. Pours almost clear red/amberish with a small creamy white head. Aroma of deep red fruits, juicy and sweet. Taste is moderate sweet, dark red fruits, mellow fruity malts lingering fizzy and fruity.

#3000: 0.75 l bottle from former Firma Bier, best before May 2017, accidentally cellared for about two years. Almost clear, dark brownish red with a thin, fluffy, quickly diminishing, off-white head. Sweetish, slightly sourish, moderately fruity and a bit oxidized aroma of caramel, cherries, strawberry jam, some balsamic vinegar and hints of oak. Quite sweet, moderately sour, very fruity taste of balsamic vinegar, cherries, vanilla, oak, red grapes, strawberry jam and marzipan, followed by a medium long, moderately tart, woody-dry and slightly vinous finish. Medium body, slightly astringent and quite effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Great stuff, very well balanced, sweet and sour flavours merge fantastically. Mouthfeel is very pleasant as well, not too astringent, overall extremely refreshing. Very good!

A 750ml corked and caged bottle with a best before date of 19th May 2017. Poured into a Cantillon ballon glass. It was a dark ruby red colour with a half finger off white head that dissipated quickly and left some sparse lacing. Aromas were berry fruit forward, lightly sweet with raspberry, cherry and cranberry. Finish is lightly tart with earthy oakiness. Tastes great with a good balance of tart, lightly sour and lightly sweet, with raspberry, cherry and cranberry followed by some nice light oak woodiness. Dry-ish, medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall this is just really good. Nicely balanced, smooth and very fruity. I could drink this all day. Even though this particular bottle was nearing its best before date, it felt as if it would still be good to drink over the next few years.

Wersja 2013. Świetny, świeży, orzeźwiający aromat truskawek, malin, żurawiny, fig,wiśni z akcentami winnymi. Smak równie owocowy, rześki, niezwykle odświeżające w ustach. Subtelne, umiarkowanie kwaśne z akcentem słodyczy i garbników. Niezwykle urzekające lekkością i balansem.
Aroma of red fruit (dominantly cherry) and some of the lambic like stable. Fruity in the mouth but acidic in the afterteste. Nicely carbonated. Really good.

Reddish brown pour, smaller head fades away fast. Lush berry aroma, cranberry, raspberry, cherry, yeast, lightly sour, oak. Fruit forward taste, red berries, lightly tannic, oak, Very light acidity, light tartness, Lighter body. Quite easy to drink in large quantities.

0.75 bottle, edition 2013. Pours red with subtly pink foam. Aromas of fruits: cherries, raspberries, hints of marzipan/almonds and sourness. Moderately sour with subtle sweetness. Lots of fruits in taste and aftertaste. Very smooth, medium bodied. Wonderful beer.

Botella. @Cimmeria, Oviedo 18/03/2017
Color marron rojizo con una pequeña corona de espuma blanca, sabor dulce/acido con notas a fruta seguido de madera con una sutil acidez final, agradable.
W aromacie żurawina i malina, taka lekko kisielowo-żelkowa. W smaku mocny ślad drewna, dużo tanin i w sumie niewiele więcej. Delikatnie zbyt duże nasycenie.

Bronze color with a thin wispy head. Aroma is fruity with cranberries & raspberry. Light bodied. Taste is very fruity, cherry and cranberry with a hint of oak. Tart finish is all cherry. Light and refreshing. No lacing.

Bottle. Pours clear red. Aroma of currants, cherry, strawberry, lemon, petrol. Tart, somewhat funky. Medium body. Complex and balanced. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours clear red. Aroma is sour, berries, cherries, raspberries. Taste is sour, but a very nice balance with berries. Awesome!
Very good beer of its kink. Rich taste and a good body. A beer to enjoy on a hot day, or in a freezing winterafternoon.

It pours reddish brown with an off white head. The aroma has cherries, raspberries, lush fruit flesh and mild sourness. It has a medium body with semi sharp carbonation. The taste has the aroma with spice, pithiness and sharp fruits. Excellent.
Ripe raspberries on nose, tart cranberries in taste, dry figs, brett leather, wet wood, light sweetness, super smooth sour fruit beer

Geschonken als compensatie wegens een misverstand in de communicatie op hun website over de 750 genummerde Rodenbach Alexander flessen waarbij de indruk werd gewekt dat deze 750 flessen die online werden verkocht de enige beschikbare zouden zijn op de Belgische markt. Excuses aangenomen. Deze afgehaald bij mijnbierdoos.be op 18/11/2016. En geproefd op 21-01-2017. Rodenbach Caractere Rouge / 2013 is een rood-bruin (EBC 65) en helder biertje. Het schuim heeft een licht roze kleur en bij het uitschenken krijg je een normale hoeveelheid van, het vormt een gelijkmatige laag op het bier maar slaat zeer vlug neer, het gaat snel bijna helemaal weg, er blijft slechts een ietsie pietsie van over. Ook een normale wandkleving genoteerd. Rodenbach Caractere Rouge / 2013 heeft een zoet en fruitig aroma, ik moet denken aan framboos en natuurlijk krieken. Dit aroma wordt na een tijdje steeds sterker. De smaak is zuur, en licht zoetig, ook de frambozen en de krieken zitter erbij. Kwa mondgevoel geeft Rodenbach Caractere Rouge / 2013 een volle smaak, is hij wat bitterdroog, volmondig van textuur en komt hij wat prikkelend over (misschien door het zure?). Alles tesamen is Rodenbach Caractere Rouge / 2013 een harmonieus biertje te noemen ondanks dat het zure het zoete wat overheerst. De nasmaak vloeit wat uit en is zoetig, zuur en lichtjes droog, de krieken en nu ook de veenbessen zitten er in. Rodenbach Caractere Rouge / 2013 is niet slecht, maar hij zou toch wat zoeter mogen zijn. Ik denk wel dat hij heel ideaal is om er gerechten mee te bereiden.
Tap @ Dunkels. Pours hazy red with a small pink head. Aroma of jammy raspberry, bubblegum, funk, tannis, woody. Taste is rather sour with loads of fruits and dry barrel.

Clear, medium amber to red body with an off-white head that sticks to the glass. Strong aroma of raspberries, strawberries and other sweet red berries, and a perfect amount of caramel. Strong flavour of cherries, raspberries and caramel, with some marzipan and almonds in the back. There is a close to perfect balance between berries on one side and yeast and malt on the other, I often find beers with fruits to be completely dominated by adjunct. The taste is moderate to light sweet and light acidic. Mid-bodied, smooth texture and moderate carbonation. A lovely brew!
[sample from 75 cl bottle shared with Doblougløkkas ølsmakerforsamling]

Served in a Rodenbach flute on tap at the Hop Alley (GA) brewpub.

Beautiful presentation (the appropriate glassware helps here), with a pinkish white head over a hazy red-copper colored body. The color does suggest fresh pressed red cherries. 

The rich aroma is tart and fruity with a pronounced cherry note and hints of ripe berries.. 
Flavor: tart and fruity with lots of sour cherry and hints of berries and ripe, pitted fruits. A brief bit of sweetness up front. 
Mouthfeel: medium-full body with soft, medium-light carbonation. Refined.

2013 vintage on tap at Brewski. Cherry in hue, aroma, and taste with hints of plum. Very little head but decent CO2. More tart than the Alexander (sampled both side-by-side) thanks to the cranberries.

Bottle 0,75 CL. Reddish/brownish, medium hazy, moderate head. Strong notes of raspberries and on second place cherries both in aroma and flavor, other berries as well. There are also moderate red wine notes - sweet, fruity and tart. Moderate oaky notes. Maltiness greatly fits into the rest of aromas and flavors. Lightly acidic. In overall the sourness here is not so potent, the ABV is very well hidden, no acetone, neither vinegar - great. In general great beer esp. for those who want to start their beer adventure with this style.

750 ml bottle poured a clear garnet with a small lingering pink head. Aromas of caramel, cranberry, raspberry and light cherry. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a dry tart finish. Flavors of cranberry, raspberry, cherry and light oak with a crisp dry tart lingering berry finish.

the aroma of fresh cherry, raspberries and sour plum with hints of apple vinegar, sour citrus and red wine... the taste is fruity and spicy with notes of cherry, raspberry, some other forest berries, red sparkling wine and sour citrus... the aftertaste is sour and dry with woody tartness...

Sampled on tap at the Brick Store Pub. Pours hazy red, with a medium, foamy, tan head. The nose is black cherries and cranberry sauce, with some vanilla, caramel, and oak. Sweet and fruity, with a smooth but assertive sour flavor. Light to medium body, with an acidic, creamy mouthfeel. This is a delicious and well done sour.

750ml bottle. Muddy reddish body with a pretty much non existing head. Berries in the aroma, especially raspberries. Flavor is juicy, where raspberries also dominates, followed by citrus and sweet cherry notes. Tart, but not at all as their beers usually are. Kind of easy to drink and juicy, but I like it.

0.75l fles gedeeld met Jeroen en Lion. donker rood met een bescheiden creme kraag. Geur en smaak worden vooral overheerst door cassis en kersen daarnaast subtiele hout tonen. Smaak houdt het midden tussen zoet en zuur, klein beetje ziltig in de afdronk.

75 cl bottle from Alcostock?  14.99. BB... nope. Edit: oh, there it is, on the bottom: 18.05.2017. Pours kinda maple syrupy purplish-brownish red. Head off-white, not too big, retains around the edge. Aroma of indistinct berries, cherry most recognisable, with a strong hit of the tiny yellow vitamin C pills that I used to take, woody too. Tastes sourish sweet with an acidic/vinegary tanninic twist. Cherries mixed with cranberries, perhaps, indeed. Later on its like licking oak. No leather or tobacco as said on the label. Rather active carbonation, body medium, finish woody dry and somewhat sticky. Pretty good but kinda confusing considering its average score is above 4, and it being no 5 in the Sour Red/Brown category.

BTW. Is it really necessary to add corn, sugar, fructose, vitamin C and E405 in a beer? Has it always been like this? If not, when did they start doing that?

W aromacie super soczyście, owocowo, wiśnie, ciemniejsze owoce, poziomki (ten aromat dominuje), lekka wieś, super! W smaku podobnie, soczystość dominuje nad wsią, kwaśność zaznaczona, ale stosunkowo lekka. Półpełne w ustach, wiśniowo - poziomkowe, o tanicznym finiszu. Zacne, naprawdę zacne!
2013 editie. Roodbruine kleur met een goede kraag. Ruikt fruitig, honing, houtig, crème. Smaakt fruitig, citrus, zurig, houtig, tikkeltje bitter.

2013 vintage bottle. Pours a hazy pale red, low white head. Berry aroma, acidic sourness, light yoghurt. Cherry flavour that leans far more sour than sweet, light vinegar, a little barrel wood, light tannins. Drinks so well, feels like 4% and has a flat start then the fizz kicks in. Gets better over a whole bomber. Tart fruit and crisp. Excellent.

Mooi roze in het schuim. Verfijnde neus met zuren van rood fruit. In de smaak het typische oud bruin maar geflankeerd door kriek en ander rood fruit. Zeer mooie afdronk met mooi uitgebalanceerde zuren.

Redish pinkish colour, pinkish head. Aroma of vingar, raspberries, strawberries, wood, red wine. Taste is medium sour, light sweet a lot of red berries and oak flavour. Light body, slick to thin texture, lively carbonation. Very impressive! Its the gift to myself for my 28th birthday.

Röd, oklar, vitt skum
Lukt: röd sylt, mandelessens, lite spritig/lacknafta, lite bark
Smak: papprig/torr, röda bär, syrlig, läskande syrlig eftersmak, 
Mandel, lacknafta, syrligt, 
Lagom med kolsyra som ligger kvar, fantastiskt gott!! Man vill bara ha mer!

750ml bottle, 2013 vintage. Dark red with light red head. Aroma is sweet raspberries, light raspberry marmelade, sour cherries, wood, light cranberries, a light touch of almond/marsipan and light vinegariness. Taste is similar with a nice balance of fruit sweetness and acidity with the full spectra of the fruits used, though with raspberries and cherries being most noticeable, and backed up by a nice woodiness with lighter almond/marsipan and red vinegar notes in the background. Medium mouthfeel, medium carbonation and lasting intermingled fruit aftertaste.

75cl-fles van bij Tabac&Co-Palais des bières te Dottenijs (in Famiflora). U: Sterk wazig roodbruin met een zeer kleine licht beige schuimkring. G: Rood fruit, lactisch, brett, vineus en hout. S: Veel zoet rood fruit, funky brett en een zurige afdronk. M: Volmondig met een stevige carbonatie.

Es un vinagre de frutos rojos añejo en madera con un aspecto difícilmente superable.
En boca es larga y la acidez es más al primer golpe. Luego se comporta bastante bien. Una maravilla
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

2013 bottle, bought at Tobu Ikebukuro. Pours brownish red, ringed retention, very fast micro clustered streams. Fruity strawberry-cherry jam, natural and pungent. Immediate big tart fruity entry, deep cherry-raspberry-strawberry jammy, fruit vinegar, sour red berries, mellow malt, background woodiness. Wow this is incredibly interesting. Much better IMO than Cascade brews.
on tap rossastra schiuna media discreta persistenza cantina legno ciliegia leggero acetico filo agrodolce media intensita discreto acido piacevole ma non estrema

Barwa rubinowa, piwo lekko przymglone. 
Aromat zdominowany czerwonymi owocami: wiśnie, truskawki, lekko kwaśny.
W smaku wyraźnie kwaśne, lekko octowe, dużo czerwonych owoców (wiśnie, truskawki, maliny) nieco nut ściągających, drewnianych. Złożone i pyszne.

Tart aroma in a crimson pink pour. Taste is almost puckeringly tart to start - but berry fruit sweetness kicks in to save the day. Overall, a complex combination of ingredients and process makes for a benchmark of the style (albeit not one Im a huge fan of).

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2017 Piana średnio obfita, niezbyt trwała. Barwa czerwona, lekko opalizująca. Intensywny aromat składa się przede wszystkim z nutek czerwonych owoc?w, wytrawnego czerwonego wina, starej beczki. W smaku kwaskowe, nieco w typie octu jabłkowego, intensywnie wiśniowe i malinowe, lekko winne, delikatna słodkość w typie suszonej żurawiny, na finiszu odrobina tanin, wanilii i zioł. Goryczka pestkowo pikantna, niewielka, wysycenie średnie do niskiego.

Faktycznie czuć, że jest to piwo zrobione z dużym zaangażowaniem, czuć kompleksowość, złożoność i potęgę czasu, w jakim trunek dojrzewał w beczkach... Klasa!

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2016 From Delh*** Nivelles :: Bottled 2013 >> Belle rouge aigre-douce aromatisée au fruits rouges et vieillie en fût. A mon palais les arômes fruitées jurent par trop sur le belle maturation boisée. Nez magnifique: la framboise et la cerise titillent en 1ers les narines. Arrivent ensuite quelques senteurs balsamiques accompagnées dun maltage caramélisé doux sans amertume. Dabord acidulée, lattaque devient fort fruitée charnue sans tomber dans la facilité du sirupeux. Au contraire: beaucoup de finesse également dans la rondeur équilibrée douce mais pas épaisse; cependant qui lempêche de contre-balancer la présence virile des fruits. Quant aux saveurs boisées, elles se révèlent en en milieu de bouche avec finesse sur des notes vaguement vineuses aigrelettes qui accentuent lacidité orginelle. Le tout marque le palais avec longueur, les fruits restant trop prégnant pour moi. #374

Bottle shared at the July 2016 MDBG tasting, 7/11/16. Clear dark red, thin fizzy off-white head, good retention. Aroma of cherry, raspberry, plum. The taste is tart cherries, raspberries, lemon, chocolate, oak. Medium bodied.

Bomber from Whole Foods Market Fair Lakes (VA)
Aroma: vinegar, sour fruits
Appearance: amber with a tan head
Taste: medium sourness, 
Palate: medium body, slick feel, average carbonation, long finish, 

Excellent

Bottle Pour 0.2cl at Skuli Craftbar in Reykjavik. Awesome red color, notes of balsamic vinegar, cherries. Well done and balanced! Sweetness, sour taste and very great aromas!
Draught at Fran Well Oktoberfest. Rose pour with little head. Nice blend of cherries and raspberries with a sour vinegaryfinish. Very smooth.

750ml bottle. Reddish brown pour. Aroma is mixture of raspberry and cherry, combined smells like leather and vinegar. Taste is oak barrel up front and more cherry than raspberry. Interesting, really complex and pretty good.

Beautiful brown-red beer, luminous, slightly opaque, with a weak white head.
Smell is sour and full. Wood, sour cherries, vanilla, apple, raspberries, maybe some elderberry and even subtle honey. Quite full, almost like wine. Touch of salt, hint of caramel.
Taste is full and smooth. Deliciour sour fizz which makes the mouth water. Subtle bitterness in the background balanced against sweetness. Crisp lightly metallic dry finish. Lots of flavours that mingle beautifully: wood, cherries, hint of lemon, maybe even raisins.

750ml bottle, best before 2017-04-29. Pour red with brownish notes. No foam, just a small cloud. Aroma is from small fruits, raspberries and cherries, wood, wet leather and vinegar. Taste is very complex and hard to tell whats is front of what. Sour malt, cherries, wood, leather.... Its in the WOW factor. Medium carbonation, slick and sweet. Long sweet finish of cherries wood and dark vinegar.
Bottle, 750 ml from MBR. Shared with JFK10000. Pours hazy deep red with small beige head. Fruity, cherries, berries, tart, wood. Medium bodied. Nice.
Draught at Pressklubben Stockholm. Semi lasting white head. Opaque red-orange color. Mild lactic aroma with a touch of red wine. Big initial acidity followed by a mild wine taste.

75cl bottle at home (25 IX 2016), shared with friends. This is the 2013 

edition, as the other batches since 2011 a degustation beer created by Brouwerij Rodenbach/Palm and food chef Viki Geunes. The maceration of fruit is an important, wine-derived treatment, used in this Rodenbach process for six months for different berries: sour cherries (five percent), cranberries (four percent), raspberries (four percent). This juice is blended with a two-year oak aged sour red ale, a wine-like specialty brew. With a scarlet red, red-orange or fluorescent red coloured brew with dark body, it lacks the impeccable head - a white foamed, pinkish gloomed collar - for having the perfect fruit beer look. The nose already comes with a sour aroma, backed with several wood, almost oak notes. Within the flavours, one can easily spot the red ripe raspberrie and red currant features. The mouthfeel is beautifully soft - could this be the maceration, or is this just imagination - with a tasteful medium carbonation, added to the acidic and fruity start. The body is more raspberry and some juniper even. The oak foeder ensures a creamy, lingering vanilla base, altough the body is not that firm in the whole. The malt features have a corn backbone, without tasting awkward nor unpleasant. The sourness is surprisingly soft, except for the raspberry mouthfeel. There is a sugary sweetness on the background, supported by sweets and leaves sensations. In the taste perception there are even hints of oranges, mandarin oranges and even some peaches. The wood features come with a keen dryness, adding to the warm red wine, bourgogne or Saint-Emilion character. This sour red wine body is not that powerfull to the very end. How to conclude this lovely brew? The macerated sweet-sour red fruits and the foeder base make up for a fine, gastronomic match. The almost perfect looks and an equally vinous nose ensure an elegant brew with a mostly firm, yet velvet mouth, making a complex old brown, with a somewhat swift finish. A Flemish classic in a wine treatment version, successful for sure.

Röd och nästan stilla. Intensiv doft med körsbär. Ett djup i smakerna och en trevlig surhet. En riktigt fin öl

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, unsure of the date, drunk at the Return of the Belgian Beer Fest, 9/17/16.Dark purple-crimson body shows good clarity and a fleeting, purple-tinged beige head.Tart berries in the nose combine with very light acetic notes, oak and a waxy/chalky note, that, while reducing the brightness, isnt off-putting and is kind of interesting. The force of the nose is poignant fruits with some softer, sweeter malts behind it and a strong vinous character. Interesting, and no flaws or alcohol, but like many of their beers lately, it seems like they are designed to actually blossom with age, as theyre just too rich, compact and overly fruity when fresh/relatively fresh.Tart, not terribly sour, with tons of varied red fruits and surprisingly more cranberry than expected. Some grape character mixes in and there is a fair amount of oak tannin, light caramel malt and tight carbonation creating a substantial body. Malic and acetic acids tickle and then pucker the mouth on the finish with cranberry and cherry lingering. Would like to revisit in about 2-4 years.
Darught @ Søernes Ølbar. Reddish with a slight pinkish white head. Fruiry/berry aroma with lime notes. Sweet and tart berry flavours mix citrussy notes and alcohol warmth. Lovely beer.

Tap reddish colour with small white head.Aroma of raspberries and cherrys,tart and slight sweet with hint of oak acid and wood nice not to sweet blend of sour beer and berrys well balancd and mild sweet finish.
Flaska systembolaget. Rödbrun vätska. Doft av röda bär, jäst och mandelmassa. I smak, kärsbär, jordkällare, socker och jord
Flaska beställd från SB. Mörkt brun med vitt skum. Syrlig och tung doft. Söt och syrlig med bra stramhet.

Draft at t Antwaerps Bierhuyske, Antwerp. Pours reddish-brown with a small off-white head. Aroma of sour cherry and raspberries. Taste is red berries, oak, vinegar, and funk. Well-balanced sweetness and tartness. Smooth finish. Excellent.

ruby red color, clear, small pinkish white foam, nice lacing; lots of red fruits in aroma, some yeasty notes, wine like acidic aroma; medium+ sweetness and sourness, light bitterness; medium body, tart, slightly oily feel, average+ carbonation, long tart finish;
Overall: fantastic

One of the original 900 bottles shared. Thanks Shuichi! Huge tart cherry and raspberry nose with oak. Everything is so well-integrated on the palate. Smooth and creamy vanilla and berries. Super fruity. Sweet, but not overly so at all. Very approachable and has a well-balanced body. Great stuff!

0.75 bottle.   A very hazy, crimson color with a small, off-white head of good retention. A pungent aroma of wine, strawberries, acidic tones of fermentation, wild yeasts, and delicate hints of ash and tobacco. Taste is sweet and sour, very fruity, mouthwatering, delicately smacking of earth. A medium body, an oily texture, and a soft carbonation. Finish is long, sour, more woody and ashy; the fruits have undergone a sudden change and now taste much more fermented going in the direction of Balkan fruit liquors. Overall a great beer, well-balanced and simply drinkable.

Bottle. Pours nice red in colour with small pinky head. Aroma of fresh berries, cherries with light (really just a touch) vinegar. In taste fruit in a fantastic way, cranberries and tart cherries upfront then light vinegar, funk and wood. Medium body, moderate carbonation, dry and fruity tart finish. Maybe it was really fresh bottle but it was all about fruitiness with a touch of funk and tartness and not sourness, vinegar, funkiness. Fantastic mix, very light, fruity an easy drinkable.
Kraftwork, Philadelphia tap: pours reddish brown with a white head. Aroma is cherry, tree, vinegar. Taste is sour. Lightly sweet. Very woody. Deeply complex. Nice.

This is from the first batch, one of those 900 bottles you can read about in the description. Aged for years.Thank you Shuichi! Pours red, not really much carbonation there. Aroma of cherries, cranberries. Nicely fruity and light sourness. Taste is full of flavours, sour, some vinegar, strawberries, cherries. Silent but deadly, fully satisfying. No sharp edges but I guess that comes from the age. Aftertaste is dry, initial sweetness is still there but tannins are doing their work. I love that silent aggressive balance that this beer has.
August 2016. Fermentoren CPH. Tap. Pours reddish brown with a bit of head. Delightful aroma of fruits, ketones (?). Typically complex Rodenbach flavor with much in terms of fruits. Very pleasing.

Bottle. Pours hazy red brown with quickly fading beige head. Aroma is light sour fruity with cherries and raspberry yet malty with some caramel notes. Taste is complex and has winey character with cherry, raspberry and malty, caramel and slightly dried fruity notes to the dry end of this fantastic beer. Also tasted on tap at Søernes.

Rating #1000! Bottle at Mikkeller Aarhus. Aroma of tart cherries, raspberries, cranberries, light brett. Clear brownish red with mostly lasting white head. Taste is dry, moderate fruit sour and light bitter. Light+ body, dry feel, tart cranberry and raspberry finish.

BOTTLE. Gold to ruby pour with a ruby/white head.. Insane sweet nose, hard boiled lollies, all the berries, fruit liquorice, woodiness from the barrel all combined.. Balance of sweet & tart berry flavour through out, good zesty sour kick to finish.. Sourced Cape Cellars

On tap at Whole Foods at Fairfax Corner in Fairfax, VA. 

Very hazy, chestnut-red with a thin pink-white head and fair to sparse lacing. 

Aroma of big time berries, cherries and balsamic vinegar. 

Taste of mashed mixed berries, balsamic vinegar and cherries. 

Medium body and medium/low carbonation with a smooth, light mouthfeel that pairs well with the fruity flavor.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750 ml bottle poured at Eugenes farewell tasting. Thanks! Very fun try. Reddish orange pour with no head. Lighter cherry aroma. Flavor is a larger cherry pie like character, with a smooth, wonderfully tart and sweet complimented finish. Memorable, and excellent on all counts. Loved it.

(Bottle) Red colour with foamy pinkish white head. Fruity, slightly sour nose with cherries, raspberries, red fruit, hints of oak wood and balsamic vinegar. Fruity, tart taste with notes of raspberries, cherries, cranberries, oak wood, balsamic vinegar and a dry and tart finish. Medium body, mainly dry. Not quite as deep and complex as the Grand Cru, but more balanced and really tasty and enjoyable. Excellent beer.

Bottle, 2013 ed. Semi clear deep red, white/pinkish quickly dissipating head. Aroma is full of berries, cherry, marzipan, tooth paste, sweet malty notes. Taste is sour in the start, dry berry sourness, later fine sweet malty notes, marzipan, cherry and candy, all while remaining freshly sour and woody in the back, finishes dry with more berries. Medium body, surprisingly high carbo. This is world class.

Draft at Briljant, Haarlem. Red with a reddish offwhite head. Tart aroma of red fruits, wood, malts, light acetone alcohol. Taste is sour, red fruits, wood, malts, dry finish, light funk, tart red fruit aftertaste. Not bad.

Bottle at Sommerhuset. Thanks Mads. Pours a clear light brown with a small white head. Sweet and sour with a mellow bitterness. Aromas of raspberries with notes of balsamic vinegar. Also hints of toothpaste. Medium bodied. Medium to high carbonation. Sour and bitter finish.

Zniewalający, złożony aromat. Czerwone owoce, słodkie praliny, likier owocowy, lekka kwaskowość. Piwo czerwone, niemal klarowne. Piana słaba. W smaku podobnie - słodko i kwaśno. Czerwone, dojrzałe owoce, winny posmak.

Draught at Brewdog Helsinki. Ruby red color, minimal pink head. Sour taste with cherry, raspberry, tart, a bit of oak, grass and a bit of toast. Sour finish with cherry, raspberry, tart, earthy notes and oak. Exquisite sour red.

Aroma: cherry, raspberry, wine, some woody, spicy and wild notes
Taste: medium sour, wine, cherry, wild, spicy, raspberry, cranberry, light kefir
On tap @ Rover. Hazy reddish amber with a tiny off white head. Fruity and sour tones. Fruit, acidity, wood and malt. Medium body with a nice balanced sour/ sweet finish.

UPDATED: JUL 29, 2016 Clowdy red with a medium white/reddish head. Strong aroma of berries, followed by light caramel and oak. Taste reflects the aroma, with a medium sourness. Low to medium body, dry texture. Medium carbonation.

Tap @Lawendowa 8 Gdańsk. Berry aromas- a lot of them! Like all the berries in the world went for a party and started a mosh-pit with some herbs and spices... Seems that dark chocolate went for that party too, was not feeling for a mosh-pit, enjoyed watching and got lost somewhere in the crowd. Pours dark, reddish copper with off white head. The taste is fruity sourness of berries (raspberries mostly) and some malty underlying sweetness. Very tasty. Sparkling wine style carbonation. Overall a lovely beer. Would drink it again gladly!

Fantastiskt vacker röd färg med rosa skum. I doften finns massor av syrliga bär, mest märks tranbären men tydliga toner av hallon och körsbär finns där också. Maffig smak med mycket tranbär men även lite sötare hallon och körsbär i en bra balans, inte översyrlig utan fin balans mellan syra och sötma.

In aroma cranberries, some strawberries, rapsberries, cherries and some tingy herbal mintyness, some woody undertones, little wild notes and spicy notes. Deep red, clear colour with small pink head. In taste- beer changes as it warms up, at first there are some cranberries/rapsberries with spicy notes in the back and some minty/herbal and wild undertones and tart woody finish (which lasts to aftertaste). After a while on the first place comes some cherries mixed with rapsberries. Medium carbonation, medium body.

Drunk from 75cl bottle bought from delhaize in Brussels. Enjoyable sweet sour beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap. Deep reddish amber with small head. Huge tart berry, like a fruit explosion. Light oak. Really great stuff, but Id still give the nod to vintage.

Tap at De Paas. Slight hazy red with light brown hue and creamy pink head. Looks amazing. Overripe red fruit, typical Rodenbach oxidized sherry with light glue, fresh respberries, cherry juice, some berry pits, dead leaves, hay, white grape skins. Medium sour and sweet. Medium bodied with slick feel and soft prickly champagne like carbonation. Lovely beer.

From tap at In De Wildeman, Amsterdam. Aroma is loads of tart cherries and berries, mild oak, sourish red fruits. Flavour is tart and mild sour with a nice little sweetness. Body is medium. Lovely sweet/sour flavour and lots of tart red fruits, great beer.

On bottle from Vinmonopolet Vika October 2014. Red color, good foam. High aroma intensity; cherries, raspberries, some notes of stable and good fruitiness. Medium body & complexity. Good sourness, balances well. Very enjoyable 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

75cl bottle shared by Arve_Christian - thanks a lot! Pours hazy caramel brown, some reddish notes and a fairly small, off-white head. Delicious aroma of sour berries with some wooden and slightly earthy notes, hints of dried fruits and malt. Sour, fruity and complex with lovely flavour of raspberries and cherries and a nicely sour finish. Delicious stuff!
Sour red cherry, musty yeast, and straw aroma. Cloudy ruby red with minimal head. Sweet-tart cherry, malt, yeast , and mildly bitter straw flavor. Nice body. Pretty sweet for the style.

Tap at Cafe de Koffer. Clear red copper with thin offwhite head. Cherries, cherry stones, strawberry, woodglue, cinnamon, cork. Very sweet base with vinegar sour softly leaning in, quite a sour sting eventually. Medium body, low to no carbonation. Lactic response. Quite dry, with a cinnamon soft finish.

On tap at Delirium Brussels. Pours hazy red with thin light pink head. Aroma of raspberries, strawberries, red vinegar. Taste is sweet berries with sour finish, light tart. Medium body, soft carbonation, alcohol well inserted. Nice one.

Tap@ de Klep. ABT bier van de maand.. Rode kleur, schuim verdwijnt tot een laagje op het bier. Aroma van cassisranja . Smaakt zoetzuur, kersen, stoffig, niet echt complex. Viel me tegen gezien de hoge score op ratebeer.

F: not big, pink, quick gone.
C: red to dark red hazy.
A: cherries, raspberries, blackberries, light vinegar, apple, woody, cider, hint of vanilla, tobacco, leather, floral.
T: fruity, light tarty sour combines with great sweet fruitiness of berries, vanilla, tobacco, oak, woody, caramel, basement, green apple, lemon, quite complex taste and smell, great beer of this style, worth to try, Limited edition 2013, 0,75l bottle /7,9e/ surprisingly from Delhaize in Brussels.

Pours a deep ruby color with orange highlights and a tan ring. The nose is big tart fruit, cherry, cranberry, raspberry, wood with a nice sweet/sour aroma. The taste is initially sweet fruit with strawberry and raspberry then some sourness, slight vinegar, wood ending very dry. Light/medium in body with active carbonation. I simply love this beer.

Tap in de vlaamsche Reus. ABT bier van de maand. Prachtig glas, 20cl, combinatie van een champagne en een bierglas. Mooie warm oranjerode kleur. Licht troebel. Mooie zachte zuurheid, juiste hoeveelheid zoet. Lekker!

clear red liquid with white head. aroma of cranberries, rasperries and cherries. tastes same. light sweetness, lightly bitter, heavily sour, oak in aftertaste. medium body, creamy feel, average carblong finish,

Aroma: raspberry, cranberry, strawberry. Most fruity! Appearance: hazy, red, no foam. Taste: heavy sour, light sweet, light astringent oak bitter. Palate: medium body, creamy texture, light carb, very light bitter aftertaste.
Tap. Clear, red, frothy, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly sour, medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation, & long finish.

Bottle. Hazy chestnut brown with a medium sized diminishing off white head. Berries, wood, nail polish and vanilla in the nose. Flavour has berries, wood, hay, dust, light sugar. Some sweetness, light sour. Not much depth and fairly sweet. Underwhelming.

Wood, cherry, raspberry, cider vinegar, beautiful amber/reddish colour with a small and not persistant white/beige head, medium body and high carbonation, taste is an amazing sensation: sweet and sour, cherry and raspberry than cider vinegar again, dry finish, very refreshing, taste of Rodenbach is not compromised by the fruits that donated to this beer a delicious sweetness...like a whisper, like a gift for a king, like a masterpiece, i can not forget it.
Clear red, small red foam ring remining. Light sour aroma and likewise in taste, Cherry and wood notes. Complex, great. (Nijmegen 201604)

Bottle. Aroma is sour caramel, fresh sunripe berries, hints of orange and citrus. Brown amber, cloudy, medium small off white head. Light sweetness, medium sour, taste is sunripe berries, caramel, port and sherry, hints of vanilla. Medium body, soft carbonation, long complex and slightly sour finish. Fantastic!

75cl bottle. Not the first or the last. Amazing cranberry/cherry aroma. Taste is vinegar, fruity tartness, oak, medium sour, w/ the classic Rodenbach aftertaste. My favorite Flanders red/brown.
Bottle. Pours cloudy rubby red with low head. Aroma is fruity, sour cherries, cranberries and wood. Taste is sour, acid, fruity, dry smooth, nice.

Pours a deep ruddy red with a thin beige head. Lots of pie cherry in the nose with sour and tannic cranberry, cherry pit and almond, and a touch of phenolic acidity. Bright berry notes in the flavor with cherry predominant and cranberry on the back. Nice acidity/tartness upfront with a touch of marker/phenolic. Medium light bodied and dry.

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2016 75 cl bottle, served in a wine glass. Poured a cloudy red with a two finger off white, pinkish head. Delicious aromas of cherries, cranberries, raspberries, oak, tart, caramel, flowers. Taste: OH WOW! cranberries, cherries, raspberries, tart, very vinous, caramel, vanilla, very oaky, woody dryness, vinegar, granny smith apples. Very complex tastes of sweet, sour and dry. The sour is not overwhelming at all. A medium body with a long dry and fruity tart finish. Rodenbach really outdid themselves with this fruit nectar. Absolutely heavenly!

75 cl bottle poured in to a Snifter. Dark red colour with an amber tint. Thin, off-white head. Lovely colour. Tart, fruity aroma with sour cherries, raspberries, cranberries, oak, sweeter fruits, caramel malts. Leather and tobacco. Nice wooden nuances. Taste is lightly sour. Medium body with a creamy texture and a soft carbonation. Finishes lasting dry and tart fruity. Superb Flanders Red.

Pours deep mahogany with small fizz. Smells tart and strongly of berries. Taste is sour, fruity, and subtle oakiness. Medium-bodied with a sharp texture and prickly mouth-carbonation, Rodenbach Caractère Rouge finishes with a lingering fruity tartness.

750 ml bottle. Pale burgundy body, medium head. Aroma has sour berries and light vinegar. Sweet lightly tart taste with mostly cranberries. Too much sweet cranberries, making it a bit soda-like. Not as enjoyable as the regular Rodenbachs which I love. I expected this to be a 4+ beer but its really too much like a cranberry lemonade. A bit of a disappointment.

Hazy copper/Amber with a thin rocky white cap. Amazing raspberry and cherry fruity aroma with a light sour tart. Smooth and tart ruby red cherry and raspberry flavors, fruity and sweet and almost candy like but also slightly tart and razzy. Delicious and eclectic with lots of tart and sweet fleshy red fruit. Reeeealy tasty.

Pours red with a quickly fading head.
Nose shows red fruit and berries, soft funk and little else.
Flavours include more berries, very light funk and a soft balsamic note.

Cherries, raspberries, cranberries, some vanilla in aroma. Pours red with pink head. Taste is slightly sour, very fruity, some acidic, bit sweet. No bitterness. Overall taste is not as good as nose, too one-dimensional and bit boring.

Bought September 4, 2015 at Systembolaget Sweden and has been resting in my beercellar for seven months. 

The beer pours beautifully in the glass with a dark red-brown "oak" - color. Hazy with a thin head. 

Nose: Soft, sweet, tart nose of cherry, ripe apple, prune, oak, vanilla, raspberry and earthy yeast. Im in love! 
Taste: Ooooohh! So good! Raspberry, cherry, green apple, lemon, red berries, vinegar, oak and cranberry. Fantastic! 
Mouth-feel: Full body. High but smooth carbonation. Sour, tart mouth with a great dry ending. Complex structure. 

Conclusion: This is a beer of a lifetime! Totally blow my mind! So complex, tart, funky, smooth, sour, sweet.... well its LIFE! 
Happiness and love in a bottle! 

In this totally rush of life itself have to put down this review... Its not easy but somebody has to do it...

Pours clear dark red with pink head. Aroma is rich with fruit notes, cherry, sweetness, vanilla, berries, old wood etc. Almost impossible to take nose out.
Taste is quite same, some sourness and well balanced. Fills your mouth with complex taste. Very very excellent!

Bottle: Poured a deep reddish color ale with a large foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of rich cherry notes with plenty of oak notes and some tart notes with some light residual sugar notes. Taste is a perfect mix of fresh cherry notes with some tart notes and oak with some residual sugar notes. Body is full with great carbonation.
Overall: Fruity vinegar. Smooth.Note: On-tap at De Klomp. Reviewed 2016-03-22.

How: Draught.
Where: 3 små rum, Göteborg.
Appearance: Dark red colour with a small red head.
Aroma: Cherries, fruit, vinous, sour, raspberries, some tart.
Body: Medium to full body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Sour, cherry, acidic, vinous, raspberries.
Draft. Sour red cherry, musty yeast, and straw aroma. Cloudy ruby red with minimal head. Sweet-tart cherry, malt, yeast , and mildly bitter straw flavor. Nice body. Pretty sweet for the style.

Pours dark copper, clear, with unstable foamy pinky head, which dissapeared in a few seconds. Visually low to medium carbonation. Aroma: rich fruity aroma of sour cherries, cranberries, raspberries, supported with notes of vanilla, wood, toffee...flavor: intense fruity flavor, with notes of fruits, mentioned above, supported with toffee, gentle caramel note, wood, hint of vanilla...taste is fruity sweet, slightly sour finish and sticky/ dry aftertaste. Body is medium, texture is soft, carbonation is medium. Very, very drinkable beer!

3/13/16. 750mL bottle from World of Beer - Brandon. Thank Jeebus for take home prices. Red pour with a small pink head that sizzles away. Complex aroma, mixed berries, some red Kool-Aid, vinegar, sweetness. Surprisingly sweet flavor, a little disappointed, red Kool-Aid, mild tartness. I could really use more sour and more flavor in general. Not bad, but definitely disappointed.
Reddish brown. Fairly hazy. Aroma is vinegar forward with some raspberries at the finish. Starts tart and finishes again with lots of berries.

A7vermelhada, espuma de pouca formação e persistência (estava vencida a 1 mês) . Aroma de vinho quente, maçã, cereja, frutas vermelhas, muito complexa. Paladar de leve acidez e dulçor. Corpo leve e média carbonatação. Aftertaste de uvas escuras, maça vermelha, framboesa, azedo persistente mas equilibrado . Deliciosa!
Bottle. Pours a hazy reddish brown. Aroma and taste are sweet raspberries and tart cherries.

75cl limited bottle. Pours a moderate but durable head, very light beige; orange bronzed to ruby color. The aroma is supreme, and probably its best feauture: smells every sort of type of red/blue berry, ripe fruits, with an incredible bretty and very light sweet balsamic character, wooden and cherry notes. Tastes like a really refined flanders brown, but much more nobile and complex, fruity, fresh raspberries, incredibly balanced, the brett and sour are mixed so well all together. Medium bodied, carbonation its there but quite subtle, really long and complex aftertaste. The smoothes brown sour Ive ever tasted, Im really not a fan this type of sours but this one deserves it, excellent one

Draught at 3 små rum on February 32, 2016.The label stated Limited Edition Keg Release.Hazy reddish brown color, small off-white head. Sweet, tart, cherries scent. Sweet, acidic, a tad acetic, green currants taste. Acidic aftertaste. Also some Salubrin. Fizzy mouthfeel, very low bitterness.

Tap at Malt House. Unfiltered amber-copper-red=brown. Creamy off-white head, steady. Lots of fruit depth in the aroma. Cherry, raspberry, ect...whereas the Foader was a little one dimensional, this is fruity, sour, awesome. Really fantastic, nails it. Oaky oily tones. Big sour. Huge fruit. World Class. Has the fruity boldness of a Lindemans with the sour depth of a more refined Belgian lambic.
Bottle 0,75ltr: Clear dark red coloured brew with an well balanced sour taste, great hints of mostly cherries and other sweetsour fruits.

Bottle. Reddish brown body with very small white head. Aroma is cherries, raspberries other red fruits and some wood and some balsamico. Taste is nearly the same with more sourness, and some additional malts. Aftertaste is nice sour and fruity with no bitterness. Very nice one.

Pours reddish brown with a transitory tiny white head. The nose is cherry, raspberries and cranberries(as per the deScription) along with the musty warmth of wood and sharp Parma violets. The taste is nicely carbonated with a massive hit of the fruits counterpointed well with oak and old ale. The cranberry gives a lovely length of finish. A complex refreshing and tasty drop!

750ml bottle. Faint cherry and sugar aroma. Smells much stronger as it warms up. Effervescent pour with a think red head that flattens out quickly. Less sour than anticipated, which is not necessarily bad. Light body with a long, even finish. Improves greatly as it warms to room temperature.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2016 Tasted from bottle. Pours a hazy ruby with thick off white head. Aroma is fruity with cherries and other berries, a little sour aroma but not much. Taste is very well balanced with nice fruity sweetness mixed with sour tart. Flavors of cherry, raspberry, cranberry. Very drinkable. Excellent sour. One of my favorites. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tolles saures fruchtbier! Hat super zu mousse au chocolat gepasst! Schöne rote farbe!
Wenig aber sehr feiner schaum!
750ml corked bottle, pours deep red, brown, aroma is fruity, cherries and raspberries, tart with woody notes. Great balance and very drinkable. Soft carbonation and a woody, light tart finish.

Rossa con riflessi giallastri, limpida, schiuma vagamente tendente al rosa (praticamente bianca) di media persistenza.
Aroma di aceto di mele e mela verde, ciliegia più leggera, legno, note oleose e lievissime note vinose, pelle conciata.
Al palato sempre aceto di mele e mela verde, legno, ciliegia, lamponi più leggeri, note vinose, coda oleosa ed astringente mista a leggera ciliegia macerata.
Retrolfatto acetico.

From cervezasespeciales. In Teku glass. Watching Sons of Anarchy 5x03-04. Nice fruity nose, without tartness. Fruity taste too, with sourness typical of its fruits. Wouldnt repeat however.

75 cl, bottled. Pours cloudy brown with a small white head and some sediments. Aroma: Wood, cherries, red currants. grains. Taste: Medium- sweet, notable tartness. Wood, red berries. Raspberry. Pleasant. Palate: Near medium body, average carbonation. Notable tartness. Winy characters. Refreshing. Very pleasant, yet interesting.

0.75 l bottle from Alko Arkadia (Special Limited Collection), Helsinki. Amber colour some head. Aroma is yeasty with fruits. Taste has cherries mellowed with the other fruits and great tartness. This is really a fruit beer without any sweetness. Bit more complicate than just lambic with sour cherries since the base beer is not just dry but also also somewhat malty. Still you shouldnt expect any beer like taste.

Ruby et trouble, collet fin de grosses bulles qui sestompe vite
Des aromes puissants de fruits rouges et cherry, chargés de bois et une pointe de cuir.
Montee acide progressive qui sexprime pleinement sur la finale.
Longue, pleine de fruits et de bois, très effervescente en bouche
Bottle from Biercab Shop. Reddish colour with off white head. Fruity, raspberry aroma. Sweet, fruity, raspberry, sour taste. Medium body.

Hazy light red to orange, sparkling with a thin bubbly vanishing head. Red berries, citrus, wood. Medium sweet with a dry and prickly finish. Not overly complex and no real funky character but very fresh and balanced. Highly sessionable.

Hazy pale red colour. Cranberry, cherry, vinegar, hints of wood and hay in the aroma. Does not have horseblanket and barnyard what one would expect. But it is even good. Cranberry at first. Cherry and some vinegar in the middle. Nice oakiness. Wine like finish. Quite complex, very well balanced, really tasty beer. Would enjoy again and again.
Rødbrun lett tåkete med lavt beige skum. Lukter solbær, vingummi og drueskall. Sur smak, sure bær, solbær og rips. Flyktig sødme. Kort. Vinøs. Tørr.

Bottle, 750ml. A ruby red beer with a small pink head. Sweet aroma of raspberries and cherries. Taste is sour with a sweet aftertaste of berries. Medium bodied with some carbonation and considerable astringency. Nice sour finish.

Bottle, 75cl. Deep reddish with a minimal brown head. Sweet aromas of red fruits, leather, green apples. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Sweet and lightly sour. Delicious fruity sweetness with a smooth fruity and alcohol finish. Unusual and finely crafted.
One of my favorite. Hazy brown color with tiny head. Aroma of some fruits, sour and wood. Taste is look a like wine, sour, berries, dry finish.

Bottle, deep read cloudy beer, pink head. Aroma red wine vineagar, fruit, barnyard, kombucha. Taste kombucha, cherry, peaches, red wine, vineagar. Palate is light, carbonation soft, moderate. This is so good!

750mL bottle for NYE. Poured a murky mahogany with ring of head. Acidic, tart fruity notes of sour cherry, raspberry, grape, and cranberry all present. Slight vinegar. Great stuff, probably not worth the price tag.

From bottle, birthday gift from snullergøjen Thomas! Pours hazy brownish red with a tan head. Aroma of bubblegum, lots of red berries, sweet, light tart. Taste is sweet red berries, some light wood and funk, light sour finish. Really well balanced!
Mörkröd med litet skum. Doftar riktigt bra! Massor med hallon och tranbär i doft och smak! Lite syrlig och balanserad

Bottle @ deTolly; Tartu. Pours brownish red with tan head. AROMA: sourish, berries, vinegar, strawberries, cranberiies. Taste is medium sour with some sweet notes, slight vinegar, berries, cranberries, red currant, apple cider notes, some wine notes. Well balanced, easy to drink. Well hidden Abv. Nice beer.

Bottle at home, 29th December 15. Pours a dirty red bronze, lace rum. Aroma is raspberries, pee, sour fruit, barrel cellar, damp wood. Taste is cherry, raspberry, may be a hint of sour cranberry, barrel, sherry, slightly sour finish. Excellent
Bottle. Pours Dark Reddish Amber. Aroma is Fruity with a hint of vinegar. Taste is fruity sweet up front with a dry tart finish. I would say without a doubt i get cherries and raspberries. I like it.

Bottle with my missy. Pours amber red with a tiny white head. Aroma of Cherry and cranberries with off-notes of Brett. In mouth aroma of oak and tannins also comes thru in the end. The flavours starts sweet but quickly turns sour to finish dry as cranberries. Fizzy carbonation. Elegant and enjoyable.

On tap at Noreys in Newport RI. Pours a clearish red/pink/Amber, white/pink head. Aroma is a bucket of cherries, oak, wood, raspberry, light medicine. Flavor is medium sweet, some vinegar and cherry/berry. Lovely

No toothpick character which is surprising given it aged in oak for two years. Strong acetic acid but more of a vinaigrette sweetness, not harsh or solvent-like. Lots of luscious fruit juice. The cranberry and sour cherries really stand out countering the acid and barrel with a really pleasant juicy fruit presence. Smells incredible.

Some dark malt flavors in there along with prominent vinous dark fruit. Tart cranberry and sour cherry really stand out along with other dark berries. Well balanced and surprisingly drinkable considering the complexity and sour acidity. Subtle mineral flavor and somewhat kriek like with dry fruit skins, jammy seeds and sweet fruit juice.
