Bottle from Dranken Pauwels, Belgium. Pours murky brown/red with no head. Nose is sharp malt vinegar, apple vinegar, raspberry, cherry, sour and tart, hints of wood barrel, earthy. Taste is sharp, acidic, lactobacillus sour and tart, berry sourness, vinegar acidic, malt vinegar, raspberry and cherry fruit, aged oak wood.

Bottle sample at the tasting, thanks! Hazy amber-brown with a small head. Aroma of berries (raspberries, cranberries), wood, cherries and wine, a bit funky. Taste - sour berries, caramel, prunes, cherries with slightly dry finish, delicious. Medium-bodied, oily and smooth. Great.

Huge aromas of sour berries and cherries. Lovely burnt amer color tiny bubble ring of head. Wonderfully tart raspberry and cherries long lasting slow fades. Smooth for how Sharp the berry tartness is.

At a tasting, many thanks, smallish head, very cloudy rod to brown color, aroma is a melange of dark fruits - dark cherries raspberries blackberries, currants , fresh berries flavor with some plums and caramel, medium pronounced sourness with a light sweetness balancing. Great fun to drink, yummy.

A blood red with brown notes, a head is quite weak and blond. Aroma is complex and balanced, great. Marvellous cherries and raspberries, medium and balanced sourness, some perfume, vinegar and barrel. Taste has intensive cherries and raspberries, quite strong sourness is balancing, some barrel and hint of sour cranberries. Lots of raspberries in the end. Medium+ bodied, slightly sticky, sourness is refreshning the palate. The sourness has great balance and thats not unattached and the main element as the most times with these beers. Natural and intensive cherries and berries. Nuanced. Brilliant beer.

*from old note*
Absolutely one of the best sours i have ever been drinking. Sour, very fruity and refreshing. A little sweeter than usual for the style. Almost perfect!

750ml bottle. Hazy reddish, verging on brown. Lasting head. The aroma has a blast of grape skin fruitiness, and also something Id describe like winter spices, but its likely the raspberry and cranberry combining. In the taste they make for a less distinct cocktail but the fruity dimension is a good addition to a Flanders red. Tobacco undercurrent. Classy stuff.

Bottle - 750mL corked and caged. Ruby pour with a short fizzy tan head. Strong raspberry and cherry notes, sour fruit, wet oak and earthy notes. Taste is cherry pie, sour berries, tart fruit, wet wood, earthy notes and candied fruit. Body is medium with a strong, prickly carbonation. Moderate dry finish and slightly acidic. Ends with more sour berries, tart fruit, wet oak, earthy notes and some candied fruit notes. Delicious!
Smell is nice berries and mild sourness. Taste is popping with berries and a super nice medium sourness that hits lke a brief kick and then its gone. Perfect carbonation with a nice full body.

A delight right from the moment of opening the bottle. Sublime, complex nose that immidiately overwhelms you in the best meaning of the word.I definitely get the cranberries in the nose as well as in the aftertaste. Cant even begin to decribe the explosion of tastes in between. Simply great.

Thanks to Suttree! You are the Man once again! Hazy, lovely shade of reddish-amberish-pinkish with an off-white pinkish head that doesnt ever quite disappear. Holy aroma of cherries, raspberries, cranberries, and barrel. Decadently fruity but not too sweet with a really nice, balanced, sour kick that stays with you, and big oak flavor. Medium bodied, very dry, and slightly fizzy; thick-champagne-like. This is tits!

Wow! Big thanks to nelson! Light haze but surprisingly clear. Bright ruby red pink with white head. Lots of sweet and tart red fruit aroma. Hints of oak and lactic yeast. Floral fruity sour great carbonation. Dry tannic finish. The beer is simply fantastic.

Rating #500. Courtesy of Toni Flükiger, many thanks! Reddish color with big white head. Berries, tart, woody, sweet. Taste is sweet berries and funky, but very different from the usual funk. More hayish, not aggressive. Very smooth mouthfeel. Very jam-like. Perfect carbonation. Rather delicate. Very balanced. So good. No wow-effect, just perfectly balanced and enjoyable. Lovely, despite its sweetness. Not more to say.

Thanks to the wife for the Valentines Day gift here. Pours fairly clear reddish brown, very slight head. Aroma is sour cherry, berry, faint oak, bit of caramel. Flavor matches. Delightful balanced sour note throughout. Really well done, a great reminder of just how much I appreciate Rodenbach. Cant say I could tell the berries were present, as a lot of the berry flavors here are found in the "traditional" Rodenbach beers, but very nice however you want to look at it.
Bottle cotteridge pissup. Red thin head. Nice sour dark fruits in aroma and taste great mouthwatering astringent finish. Prickly carbonated. Good stuff.

75cl bottle from Slowbeer. Pours reddish brown with a medium head, the sparkly foam quickly dying. Lots of berry in the aroma, the sour cherry is noticeable as well. Very interesting and appealing taste of cherry, sourness, some berries. Fine carbonization, dry finish.

Na, Nuancen zwischen diesen und den anderen Rodenbachs habe ICH NICHT erkannt, aber eine gewisse Milde im Abgang und ein wenig weniger Fruchtigkeit als die Nebenbuhler könnte ich schon attestieren. Eine feine Säure mit einer gewissen Süffigkeit bilden hier dennoch, wie gewohnt, eine gewisse Klasse. Und da die Balance hervorragend ist, kann man gegen dieses Piwo nix sagen.

Bottle; shared with Clayfiish (Untappd) at my place. I think it was sourced by Andy Parker or myself. Thanks Andy. 

Cherry Red. Sour acid aroma. Old socks. Vinous red wine. Sour cherries. Lactose acid. Taste is tart cherry, lactose, leather, smooth texture, citric juice. Very nicely-rounded. Benchmark for the style. Awesome.

Sample from Erzengel, many thanks. The beer has got a deep ruby-brown colour with a medium body. Aroma of mild red wine vinegar and unripe grapes. Taste of mild smooth vinegar, malt, barley, wine, mild acid and unripe fruits. The sourness is well balanced with offering a welcomed deepness. Enjoyed it a lot.
Bottle at Carsten. Clear dark pink. Aroma heavy fruity (cherries, craneberries, mint, raspberries) and acidic. Flavor light sweet, medium to heavy acidic and complex. Medium body. Wau.
2/20/2015. 750 ml. bottle. Reddish color with a fizzy pinkish head. Aromas of red berries, a little oak. Tart and tight, not overly sour. Exceptional balance that ends with a dry finish.

75cl bottle in a head to head with classic Rodenbach. Pours a reddish amber with a small, white head. Aroma is oaky, fruity with lots of dark berries, balsamico, vinegar, very dry, lots of juicy berries with some sweetness to it. Taste is a very complex mix of the sweetness and the sour and tart notes. Vanilla-sweet, oaky, dark cherries, fresh, sour raspberries and dry, slightly bitter cranberry. All very explicit. Nice, juicy medium body and medium carbonation as well.

Bottle.

Pours red amber, with a light head.

Nose has lots of berries, raspberry-like sweetness to it.

and the taste! Jeez ma weez, louise! You can distinguish all different types of berries! Sweet raspberries, sour cranberries and dry blackcurrents. wow!
Poured a clear amber red color with aromas of tart cherries, wet oak With some light malt. Flavors are tartness and cherries wet oak solid and enjoyable.

Bottle. Deep murky red, small white head. Aroma has tons of oak, caramel, vanilla, raisins, a huge fruity base topped with raspberry and especially cranberry, all of which are tart and subtly vinegary. Very complex and absolutely mouthwatering. Taste is extremely rich and powerful, vinous, oaky and packed with tart berries. It brings all the strengths from the different berries, and they all complement each other in a fine way. The palate itself is sticky and yet prickly, and envelops the tongue in a nice way.

really a great beer. Pours a blushy pink color. Aromas are cranberry, raspberry bubblegum, red wine, oak. Flavors are nice and tart. Cranberry and raspberry. The only knock on this is the quick and watery finish.

Thanks cards04 for Sharing this one. Spicy fruity aroma. Taste is sour with a dry pithy cranberry finish. Enjoyable Flemish red though I personally prefer the sour to pack a wallop while this is fruity. Nice beer.

Great fruity-sour nose, cherries, wood, moderate sour. The beer starts intense fruity. Dark cherries, very dry. nice moderate sour with wood. Great intense, very sparkling, not too sour. Lots of smooth woody sourness, fresh, not too intense, highly drinkable, great. Only the aftertaste could be a bit more longer and / or intense. But great and nice.

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2016 75cl bottle at home, best before 19/05/17. Foamy beige head that quickly disappears, beautiful reddish brown, slightly hazy colour. Fruity complexity in the nose with strawberry, cranberries, raspberry, sour cherries and green apples. Taste has this fruitiness too, quite sour and tard, fruity vinous character, light caramel malts. Sour and sweet fruits linger long, dry mouthfeel. Fizzy carbonation, medium body but good flavours. Really a one of a kind beer.

Murky red-brown. Aroma of cranberry and raspberry. Taste- semi-sour dry berries dominate. Cranberry is on the forefront. Not as sweet as I was expecting. Very nice!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750 ml bottle. Red bronze colour. Clear. Small fine white head around the edges. Funky aroma with red fruit. Cherries. Fruity meat flavours. Some sourness, but well balanced and soft. Acids and sweetness meld together nicely. Just enough carbonation. A harmonious beer. Very nice, and very much recommended if you havent tried it.

Jest to o tyle rarytas, że piwowarzy pozwalają piwu macerować wiśnie, maliny i żurawinę w dębowych beczkach. Potem piwo refermentuje w butelkach. Powstaje piwo wyjątkowe i unikalne, gdyż rocznie wypuszcza się jedynie około 900 butelek. Po odkorkowaniu i przelaniu do szkła, oczom ukazuje się ładny, czerwono-różowy kolor, z niewielką, ale urodziwą pianą. Zapach bardzo przyjemny - głównie dominują wiśnie. Ogólnie określiłbym jego charakter jako winny. Pierwsze wrażenia po spróbowaniu - lepiej pachnie niż smakuje. Jednak w miarę ogrzewania, walory smakowe zdecydowanie się poprawiały. Nieco przypominał mi krieka. Lekko kwaśny i dość cierpki - jakby grejpfrut. Reszta owoców o których była mowa, również wyczuwalna, ale w mniejszym stopniu. Ogólnie świetne piwo, bardzo pijalne, pomimo swojej mocy!

Bottle to glass. Pours a slightly hazy medium brown ruby color with a thin rim of tan head. Aroma is a delicious mix of berries, sour cherries, apple cider. Flavor has a nice mix of berries and apple cider, with a mild tartness. Overall an excellent beer, but kinda expected a bit more sour coming from Rodenbach.
Zeer complex zurig en fruitig. Geniale rijping met rosé vruchten. Smaakt altijd en overal. Fenomenaal bier.

2012 vintage, shared at Cotteridge Wines. Hazy red, still, small white head. Aroma is mostly raspberry, but has a mixture of fruits, slightly sour. Body is medium, slightly foamy, a touch of carbonation. Taste is tangy, sweet raspberry, slightly sour, no bitterness. Nice refreshing fruit beer.

Rodenbach have been using cherries in their beers for years and they certainly used their knowledge to good effect when producing this lovely brew. Reddish hue to the brown body, on top a pink topping. The sour fruits and their aromas ooze out of the bottle to attack your nasal and taste buds, you could smell the beer being passed up the table, or I thought I could! Bitter, sharp, tart and sour: really enjoyed my sample of this unique beer.
750ml bottle. Pours dark orange with a small head. Aroma is vinegar and raisin. Taste is sour, with dark red fruits and vinegar.

24th Jan 2015: Bottle, shared at the Cotteridge Wine meet, thanks The_Osprey. Rodenbach have been using cherries in their beers for years and they certainly used their knowledge to good effect when producing this lovely brew. Reddish hue to the brown body, on top a pink topping. The sour fruits and their aromas ooze out of the bottle to attack your nasal and taste buds, you could smell the beer being passed up the table, or I thought I could! Bitter, sharp, tart and sour: really enjoyed my sample of this unique beer.

Bottled, sampled at The Cotteridge Convention, many thanks to The_Osprey for this one. Reddish brown with pink head. There are certainly sour fruits to this, bitter cherries, redcurrants, spicy banana and yeast. I was worried about this one but it was lovely. Great stuff.
Bottle share. Cotteridge Beano. Rosé pink. No head. Big, fresh, floral, juicy red fruits. Lightly tart. Dry refreshing. Very pink.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Well fuck me this is just superb. The nose is juicy plum and date with raisin sweetness, oak, vanilla and red currants. Slight tartiness and you can smell the acidity. That acidity comes through in spades in the taste. Absolutely sour cherry forward stuff with a massive oaky feel. The acidity is what makes this world class, cuts through and leaves length. Sensational drop

(750ml bottle from Mikkeller and Friends bottle shop) Pours clear medium red with a orange-brown tinge and a small whitish active head that dissipates quickly while the bubbles keep coming. Aroma fresh and fruity with cran-raspberry juice character. A sweet and tart quality with a bit of cherry in behind (builds as it airs), soft lactic acid. Some leathery wood. Maybe a floral hint underneath. Cherry comes out much more on the tongue where it is sweet at first and acidic in behind. Raspberry also there in the middle especially. Barrels lends a mix of oak, leather and dried herbal undertones. Finish dry with cranberry tartness and a lingering sweet fruit note. Body is medium but syrupy with very light but sharp carbonation. So freaking fruity, lightly tart and juicy! Love it. Wood plays its part and its not too sweet but definitely isnt the most sour of the style either. Very drinkable.

Against my better judgment I decided to buy a bottle ($25.99!). Man, was I glad I did. This stuff was fantastic, with lots sour, tart flavors at first, then notes of raspberry to sweeten it at the finish. Subtle oak note throughout. Really Good!
A pink sour! Aromas and taste of fruit, oak, and wonderful tartness without too much acidity. Overall, one of the best sours I've had.

Bottle, previous batch. Pours cloudy hazel, small off white head, some lacing. Aroma is heavy raspberry, oak, stems, barnyard. Flavor is initially light sweet, light plus tart, a touch of funk. Super fruity, raspberries and cherries, really nice. Really really good.

Normal head volume, weak retention and minimal lacing - which is normal for the style. Pours a beautiful clear medium copper and garnet. 

Complex nose of tart and sour with notes of vinegar, hints of raspberry and cherry over a subtle fruit like sweetness. As it warms, oak notes are present.

Light medium body with a smooth texture that approaches creamy and has an oily characteristic as well. Above normal carbonation with a bit of effervescence in the middle and a nice burst in the finish. In short, World Class.

The flavor profile is World Class and serves as the standard against which others should be judged. It is intense, quite complex and a brewers masterpiece of balance. It begins with a burst of tart fruit, raspberries and cherries, over a slightly sweet background. In the middle, tartness gives a slight pucker with only the slightest hint of sour vinegar. The raspberry and cherry fruit flavors slowly subside and cranberry comes to the forefront over a caramel like sweetness. As the finish approaches, dryness comes to the forefront coupled still with a nice tart pucker and flavor. In the finish, oak notes come to the forefront coupled with a slow fade of tartness and slight sourness. A dry pucker lingers.

Bottle a red brown colored beer with a white head aroma malts sourness fruits red fruits raspberries strawberries and sourness flavor malts sourness fruits red fruits raspberries strawberries some caramel spicy and a sourness finish

750 ml caged and corked bottle, no date on the bottle that I could find so I have no idea how old or what batch number this is. Im pretty sure Ive had this bottle for about a year if not longer, so it does have some age on it. Served in a Prairie Teku, the beer pours a slightly hazy ruby red/brown color with about a half inch light tan head. The head fizzled away quickly, and there isnt much lacing. Aroma is nice and fruity (sweet and tart), the brew smells like raspberries, cherries, oak, vinegar, lemon and a bit of cranberry. The taste overall is a bit sweeter than I expected it to be. It tastes like raspberries, cherries (both sweet and tart ones), cranberries, oak, grape skins, caramel, vinegar and a bit of apple and lemon peel. The tart flavors were subtle at first, but then got stronger as I finished the bottle. Mouthfeel/body is medium, its a bit creamy with a good amount of soft carbonation. I think this is a pretty good overall brew. Definitely worth buying if you see it anywhere! $21.99 a bottle.

750ml c&c bottle from Xroads. Poured a slight reddish brown with a fizzy pinkish light beige smaller head. Aroma is fruity, cherry...raspberry...cranberry, medicinal, almost a hint of menthol on the backside. Body is lightly acidic, stingy carbonation and a dry finish. Flavor is a lot like the aroma, loads of fruit yet slightly medicinal and a touch of sourness. Good but not great.

750ml bottle shared by Dmac. Pours a clear reddish Amber color with a fizzy fast fading pinkish head. Aroma of sour cranberry, tart ripe fresh raspberries, and red wine vinegar. Taste of sweet fruit, lots of raspberry and cranberry, hints of tart black cherry, red wine vinegar, hints of whiskey, and a bitter earthiness in the finish.
-Short review- Raspberry, cherries, vinegar, floral notes and some funk. Vinous palate. Liked this much better than Rodenbach vintage.

Batch 2
From notes. Tasted on 9/16/12 from a corked and caged 750mL bottle, I think shared by SvT or Curtis, big thanks. Pours clear garnet red with a thick pink head that slowly recedes to fairly thick lace. The nose is nicely sour with tons of raspberry and tart cranberry skin, with a very light menthol note. The flavor is sour cranberry and raspberry with nice balancing sweetness on the back of the palate. The body is medium with a bit of stickiness, fairly lively carbonation, and a long sweet and sour cranberry and raspberry finish.

Delicious beer! Aroma was great. Musty and funky with cherry and cranberry smells. Pour was a cloudy murky deep dark red with a one finger off white head that left quickly. Taste was fantastic. Vinegar, sour cherry and raspberry flavors were big and up front. Strongly sour, but not mouth puckering. The cranberry was more noticeable as it warmed. Very strong and biting carbonation. Greatly complex and an awesome beer!
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: 750ml bottle. Ruby red with a foamy pinkish head. Slight haze. Flavors are fresh berries (raspberries, cherry, cranberries), brown sugar, oak and balsamic vinegar with spicy and vinous notes. Good sourness and tartness. Medium body, soft carbonation, smooth texture. Beautiful.

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2015 Pours a cloudy copper from the bottle with bubbly off-white head that leaves moderate lace. Aroma of deep fruity must, cherries, raspberries, dark fruit, then big lactic sour tannic wood. Taste is a little more tame, but nice sour cherry and raspberry over tannic wood and nice sweet maltiness. Wow, one of the best rodenbach beers I?ve had to date.

Pours an average frothy off-white head that mostly diminishes. Body is hazy red.
Aroma contains mostly fruits (cherry, raspberry, cranberry), a bit of oak, some lime, flowers, leather and hay.
Flavor gives a delicate mix of sweet, sour, tart and dryness that keep alternating. 
Body is light to medium with creamy texture and quite soft carbonation.
This beer is full of fruits in the right combination. I never had anything like this before.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Drank this at New Years eve. Bottle shared at home. Pours gorgeous red with pink head that fades quickly. Cherries, tartiness, red berries, quite sweet, some vinegar. Nice!

Looks.. Murky dark red, sml head.
Smells..all the berries of the rosso yet dulled by more oak, some booze.
Tastes..cranberries and the tartness of the cherry with loads of oak, some booze soaked fruit and then healthy raspberry tart burst, lingering dry berry finish

750 mL. bb 13-05-17. Body is a misty, reddish copper and supports a thin spit of silky bubbles. Aroma is sweet and tart raspberries in cream, with dashes of vinegar and cranberry. Front flavors of raspberry and cream turn to a mild sour with some dry cranberry-apple notes in the middle. Oak comes in on the finish and lingers. Near-medium body has a high carbonation that flares up annoyingly at times. Not as sour as I was expecting, but its plenty for me. Nice one, but seems like the raspberry and oak dominate a bit much, and Im usually a big fan of both.

25-12-2014, schenkt mooi rood/bruin met schuimige kraag. Aroma van de vele fruiten, hout (eiken), een vele complexe fruitzuren,. Smaken zijn redelijk zoetig, redelijk complexe fruitzuren, licht bittertje, de hout / tannine tonen komen later, medium body, glad van textuur, lage co2, en lange zuur/zoetige/fruitige afdronk. Héérlijk bier, dit is precies mijn stijl..... had om nog wat hoger te kunnen scoren niet iets voller gemogen, maar al met al is het erg lekker !
Red brown color, opaque. Cherries in the nose and taste. Mouth puckering sourness comes on quickly. Leaves a dry Pez-like fruity flavor.
Nice intense magenta red. Beautiful intense cherry tart nose. Earthy cherry taste, smooth and round, highly carbonated. Refreshing . Love it - good choice for beer #2500

Pours out a somewhat reddish cider color with a small tan head. Aroma is of sweet/tart cherries, raspberry, oak, some light tart funky notes and some cranberry. Lots of sweet/tart fruits up front. Taste is complex. Lots of fruit going on, sour cherries, raspberry, cranberry, oak, light vinegar, some mild funky notes. All the fruits play well together and not one particular one outshines the other. Very well done not over the top sour hut not over the top sweet.

Bottle shared by Sleestacksimz, pours hazy red color with white ring. Aroma is very floral and sharp with cranberry, and old lady perfume. Flavor is acidic, overly sour berries, and cherry cheese funk. Makes you sweat immediately from its overly acidic profile. Will hurt your chest and stomach if drank in quantity. Not a big fan, rather drink some new Glarus or something with less of a sour bite.

small frothy offwhite head. fair lacing. mostly diminishing. dark reddish-amber flat average-density body. aroma: cherry (artificial), port, light vinegar, leather, raspberry. if: moderate acidic light sweet acetic vinegar. ff: heavy acidic light sweet very light bitter acetic vinegar; long duration. palate: light medium body, fizzy carbonation, watery texture, heavy astringent finish. O dulcor lembra espumante rose e tambem cereja (artificial). Azedume de vinagre, lembrando tambem ameixa fresca, caracteristicos deste estilo e tambem das Gueuze, permeia o gole. 150s

Bouteille 750ml, gracieuseté de tom10101, merci Tommy! Couleur rouge framboise très mûre voilée, mousse rosée évanescente. Arôme de framboise, vineux, boisé, cerise, canneberge, confiture de cerise, côté sauvage, en somme une tonne de petits fruits rouges aigrelets. Goût de fruits rouges tout aussi présent mais plus amalgamé, acidité moyenne-faible, boisé, légère astringence en fin de bouche. Carbonatation moyenne-faible, corps moyen. Ça se boit tout seul. Excellent.

Pours murky brown with minimal off white head
Aromas of raspberries, sour cherries, almond icing, bicarbonate
Taste has lovely sweet notes of raspberries, sweet caramel, raspberries, sour grapes. Lovely!

Pours reddish brown with a low off white head. Aeomas of raspberries, cherries, redcurrant, funk, almond, citrus. Taste is cherries, raspberries, redcurrant, slight roasted notes, citrus, almond, funk. Mouthfeel is dry, tart and sparkling with medium carbonation. Great stuff!

Pours murky brown amber with low white head. Aroma of raspberries, almond icing, sweet cherries, redcurrant. Taste is big raspberry tart, lightly almond icing sweet, sweet and sour finish. Medium rich, smooth body with soft to average carbonation.

Bottle. Red- brown pour with small white head. Aroma is cassis, cranberries, cherries, red wine vinegar, date and oak. Taste is very fruity (raspberry, cherries, cranberries), balsamic vinegar, grape skin and lemongrass. Sirupy with decent carbonation. As a flanders red fan, it is a personal favourite.

750ml bottle pours semi clear bright red with a small fizzy head that fades fast. Nose is very vinous, lots of red wine characteristics met with some sweet tart fruity mixed berry, just a hint of oak. Taste is bright and spritzy with some earthy berry and red wine grape, tart balanced acidity, cranberry soda/juice. Finish is tart, some sweet crushed berries and light oaky vanilla with more of the red wine notes swirling. Nicely done but lacked the top-tier complexity I was hoping for.

On tap during Brussels vacation, vintage 2014. Red color with bright pinkish head. Aroma of cherry and cranberry, tart notes, fruity with faint woody notes. Taste is fruity and tart, cherries, tart notes, distorted malt notes with a fruity and sour finish. Really nice beer

[6140-20140121] Bottle. Pungent minty raspberry aroma. Clear, red amber body with a medium-lasting creamy white head. Super fruity cherry sour raspberry stems flavour has almost a dry stone cranberry note. Medium-full bitter body. Strange but also kind of wonderful. (8/4/9/4/17) 4.2
(c/o blankboy, w/ him, HogTownHarry, jercraigs)
Overheard: "Airelles?" "Cranberries." "My guess was poison... I was wrong."

750ml bottle shared @La Tana (Rome). Rossa viva e intensa, magnifica, schiuma bianca non molto abbondante. Al naso meravigliosi sentori vinosi e di frutta rossa, ciliegie, note di sottobosco e mentuccia, fragolina di bosco. In bocca è complessa e appagante, intensa, acida decisa, vinosa e leggermente acetica, stemperata e ingentilita dal fruttato, anche note di melograno e ribes. Corpo medio, carbonazione media. Una grandissima birra!
Bopttle from Vinmonopolet. Clowing red, no carbonation to speak of. Lovely blend of berries and sour beer, everything feels fresh and true to the ingredients.

0,75 pullo@ OPP. Sameahko punertavan ruskea, hiukan kastanjanruskea. Ei näy vaahtoa. Tuoksussa hapanta marjaa, aavistus sherrya, kirsikkaa ja vadelmaa. Maussa hapanta kirsikkaa, loppupuolella vadelmaa, makeutta, kivasti sievästi hiilihappoa. Ainoa miinus omalta osalta se, ettei ole "olutmaisempaa" .
0,75l bottle @ One Pint Pub. Pours clear red with a low head. Aroma is sour berries. Flavor is sour berries with a sweet aftertaste of fresh berries. None of the acidity of lambics. Great.
Bright red pour from 22oz bomber from blackwells, at murphs. Smells like a cherry pie. Very sweet. Fruity and sour, massive taste, delicious.

Bomber into a tulip. Pours reddish brown, with a big pink head that fades quickly. Nose is cranberries and sour cherries. Taste is pleasant, tart without being astringent, Clean short finish. Very good.

Opened on the occasion of my daughter Mauras baptism. Aroma: Cranberry and tart cherry come through more than raspberry; imminent tartness apparent in the nose. Oak is surprisingly light. Appearance: Rusty red, mostly flat pour with a scant off-pink head that dissipates quickly. Flavor: Cranberry more apparent up front; cherry comes through toward the finish with a lingering tartness. Palate: Light body, slick texture, soft carbonation, long finish. Overall: A superlative example of the Flemish Red style, and a fantastically pleasing beer otherwise. The rosé of the beer world.

This has a nice fruity but not sweet aroma. Looks quite good. This is truly excellent. A mixture of the fruits and a perfect blend of sweet and sour, such that its never too sweet and the sourness isnt extreme either. Truly an amazing beer whos only real complaint is the prohibitive price. Fantastic.
Red with fastly disappearing pink head. Excellent fruity aroma. Taste sweeter when expected, but not too sweet. Nice dourness full of fruity notes.

Reddish color with a medium formation of an off-white head with minimal duration. Aroma has notes of red fruits, mainly cramberries and cherries with some wooden hints. Flavor is very fruity, some yeasty hints, wooden notes and mild sourness. Fruity final with a slightly sourness mouthfeel. Awesome beer.

Pours clear reddish color with light tan head. Sour cherry and raspberry aroma. Sour cherry and tart raspberry flavors up front with a dry cranberry finish and some oak. Medium body with lively carbonation. Very nice.

Bottle. Pours an active white head. Red in color. Aroma is raspberry! Very nice tart taste. Even more raspberries in the taste. Very carbonated.

750 ml corked and caged bottle split two ways. Pours slightly dirty light red with a generous off white head. Lots of red berries of course, light tartness and fairly sweet finish. I expected this to be better though...

Rating #2800. Corked bottle from House Beer ($21.99). Red-rust color with a pink head that disappears quickly. Aroma is big cherry and other berries, wood. bottle at Crabbapples bottle share. pinkish red pour, medium bodied. wonderful sour, lots of tartness, vinegar, lots of berry notes. really nice

Appearance: clear pinkish red, with a quickly vanishing fizzy pink head and active carbonation.  Aroma: exploding with fruit, including prominent cherry and raspberry notes. Bottle; pours ruby with a thin beige head; aroma is very fruity and tart with red berries and a bit of vinegar; taste is initially sweet and then becomes tart with more red fruits as the dominant flavor; finish is crisp and dry; very nicely balanced between the sweet and sour; excellent beer
Great beer, tart fruit beer, with a reddish colour, I much prefer this beer to the Grand Cru.

This poured a Ruby red color with a pinkish head. Aroma was vineous, cherries and cranberries. Flavor was lightly tart, but also sweet, tons of red fruit, again light vinegar, some lemon and leather. Really tasty stuff.
UPDATED: OCT 25, 2014 Bottle. Clear ruby with thin off white head. Aroma and taste are tart raspberry and cherry with a touch of oak. Lots of lacto. Thin sticky mouthfeel. Outstanding brew.

Pours cloudy red/brown with a small white head that vanishes without trace. Nose is crazy complex. Sour cherries, raspberry, and cranberries, with raspberry first, cherry second, cranberry third. There is a sharp oak woodsy note at the very first. There are complicated bitter/astringent flavors from fruit peels. Flavor is sweetish/sour. This reminds me of a fruit lambic more than a sour. There is a little numbing sensation on the tongue. Mouthfeel is rounded at the beginning, trending towards a water finish. Clean. A little astringent. Really good.

Bottle. This was a long time want; Im glad it got distributed to the US.

A: Red bordering on brown. Cloudy. Off-white head. Some lacing. 

N: Raspberries, cranberries, strawberries, vinegar, cherry, grapefruit, lemon rind, wine grape, sugary grape. 

T: Sweet and sour. Some sweet-tart elements, but the overall flavors are nicely divided.

M: Prickly, filling carb. Medium body. Alcohol is well hiddden.

O: A superlative beer. Amply fruity, and I would dare say its reminiscent of Rodenbach Alexander.

Pours a amber coppery color with a small light pinkish head. Complex aroma with vinegar, wood, cherries, raspberries and almonds. Hints of leather and paint thinner. Taste is moderately acidic. Loads of fruityness from the berries. Sour and tart. Dry finish. Body is close to medium, mouthfeel is thin to oily with lively carbonation.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2016 750ml bottle served in a Duvel tulip glass. A: Pours a cloudy amber color with some notes of pink. Forms a aired, big bubbled and fluffy pinkish head. Medium to low retention and only few spotty lacings left in the glass. S: Very fruity, as expected. Strong notes of red fruits: cherries, raspberries and cranberries (as described in its label). Notes of sweet grains. Tart with a slightly metallic end. T: Mild sweet upfront. Again, very fruity. A juicy of red fruits: Cherries, raspberries and cranberries. Mild tartness. Smooth and extremely balanced: Not too sweet and not too tart either. Some notes of sweet malts. A little bit metallic sensation in the end. No alcohol notes. M: Light and smooth body. Good carbonation. Fruity with some tart notes in the aftertaste. O: Perfect drinkability. Very fruity, even for a Flanders Red. Extremely balanced and pleasant. Another masterpiece from Rodenbach[ BA Review @ 7/29/2013 ]

750 ml bottle

A generous person opened this at a tasting. While expensive I would certainly not hesitate to pick up another if I had the room in the cellar. A different take on Grand Cru and other Rodenbach releases, this accessible special release fits any special occasion.

Aroma / Appearance - A bright red base with vibrant head looks blood red with a thick light absorbing presence. Musty cherries, hay, straw, and cranberries give this a texture which is part Rodenbach Grand Cru and part earthy saison. How it works I dont know but I could savor it for a long time.

Flavor / Palate - Cherries and bright fruits shine from the first sip. A sweet transition is akin to Grand Cru but with more fruitiness and complexity. The cranberry finish brings to mind some of New Glarus offerings if they were transported to Europe. Thanks to the person who generously shared this world class release.

750mL Corked Champagne bottle BB 14/04/16
Had the pleasure of sharing this with a few good friends to celebrate our 30th birthdays. The night prior we indulged in a couple of rather good (and expensive!) bottles of wine; so the standard was set high.
Presents a hazy, amber body, stained red with a small, slightly pink tinged head.
Wow, this smells amazing! Red berries explode from the glass - ripe raspberry, sour cherry, some vinous almost Pinot-like character about it bolstered by a kiss of toasty oak, burnt caramel, some musty old wood and that ubiquitous browned pineapple Brett funk character.
Its a smooth ride on the palate, at least at first - a generous body to it, silky, leading with an unsurpassed elegance into a sourness thats somewhere between sour cherry & a fine aged Balsamic.
Sensory overload of red fruits on the palate - concentrated, luscious, fresh yet stewed yet not, and drizzled in a sticky balsamic reduction, with a bit of woody, barnyard funk. Sits on the palate, lingering, brooding, begging - its so easy to drink!
Phenomenal stuff! Something really special, worthy of a great occasion.

Appearance. Amber with thin white head
Aroma Tons of sour fruit
Taste: Very sweet complex malt profile with a monster sour finish of cherry and grape
Overview: Rodenbach on sweet and sour steroids. And much more memorable

Bottle. Dark red pour. Aromas of sour cherries, raspberries, and cranberries. All three shine through, very nicely balanced in that way. Flavor is just slightly acidic but balanced with fruit sweetness. This beer is delicious. Not the most sour but wonderfully pleasant to drink. Very well-balanced. A little but pricey, but I felt it was worth it.

Bottle shared thanks to Eugene. Pours a clear purplish red with a light pink head. Big cranberry, cherry, and raspberry aroma. All three fruits shine in this one. Taste is definitely sweet with a tart finish. Medium thick mouthfeel. Reminiscent of a NG beer.

UPDATED: MAR 29, 2017 Luxury product developed in collaboration with Michelin-starred chef Vicki Geunes; the original batch (2011) consisted of only 900 bottles and my rating is about one of those only. This beer consist of a specific unblended Rodenbach Foederbier with sour cherries, raspberries and cranberries dissolved in it, after which the bottles are laid to rest for half a year before being put onto the market. Pale off-pinkish head, medium thick but stable, colour a deep dark copper with warm ochre hue and calm sparkling. Powerful, utterly fruity and estery aroma, in which the Rodenbach complexity is beautifully mingled with the typical aromas of the respective fruits; impressions of vanilla and tannins, old sherry, honey, passion fruit, mango, yoghurt, passion fruit, port wine, wine vinegar... Taste equally complex and fruity, soft sourish with velvety mouthfeel, vinous, sharpish carbo at first but calming down towards the finish, soft sweetness of raspberries, fruit tartness of the sour cherries and spicy sweetness of the cranberries all noticeable and cleverly positioned against each other, caramelly touch, oak, tart, lemony acid hint in the finish, dry, complex and long, thirst-quenching and with low bitterness as is typical for an oud bruin. This must be one of the best examples of this particular style I ever had and certainly the best Rodenbach - at least that first, limited batch, as the more recent vintages seem to have become somewhat less tart, less complex and a bit sweeter.

Transfer from BA review on 10-21-13-

 Poured from bottle into a chalice glass 

 Appearance  The beer pours a lightly hazed reddish-brownish color with a rather thick and billowy pink tinted head. The head has a good level of retention, slowly fading and leaving some nice levels of foamy lace on the sides of the glass.

 Smell  The aroma is biggest of sweeter red fruit smells, with lots of raspberry, cherry and cranberry. While some of the aroma is sweet, there is also a good level of funk, oak, a bit of grass, and a rather potent sour vinegar smell creating a nice fruity tart smell for the brew.

 Taste  While there is a sweetness in the nose, there is not so much in the taste. There is a little bit upfront with some lightly sweetened blackberry, cranberry, raspberry and cherry flavors. While a little sweet is there, the flavor is largely of a quite tart cranberry flavor. A rather funky and lightly yeasty flavor is present as well along with a rather apple cider vinegar taste. As the flavor advances the sweeter flavors fade while some oak and a bit of vanilla join the tongue. The tart flavors get even stronger more toward the end with the tart cranberry fruit flavor really taking control of the fruit flavors. In the end, with all the tart cranberry coming to the tongue and a bit of a woody and grassy taste joining the flavor, a dry, funky, somewhat unbalanced, and quite tart cranberry flavor is left to linger on the tongue. 

 Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is on the slightly thinner and lighter side with a carbonation level that is on the higher side. The lighter body and higher carbonation were quite appropriate for the style, helping keep the sour and fruity flavors of the brew from becoming too overwhelming and keeping it overall more drinkable.

 Overall  It was OK, but I wasnt too fond of this one actually (at least in comparison the original Rodenbach). This was just a little too on the sour red fruit side for me. An interesting try, and if you are looking for a rather sour cranberry flavored beer then this is definitely one to go too.

Had this at the 2014 RB Pittsburgh Summer Gathering at Horny Devels place. Actually it was after the equinox at the beginning of fall, but DILLIGAF. Big thanks to James & Michelle for hosting such a nice spread of quality beers and for this particular beer a GIANT thanks goes out to estover. THANKS GENE! Has a friendly fruity smell fer sure. Look is clear darker black cherry red with a tad of brown. Good sizzle from the start. Augmented by cranberry I think. This stuff hides the alky SOOOOO WELLLLL. Much better than any other average fruity beer and this is right there at the top. Soooooo enjoyable and yummy. A very lovely beer drinken experience. This beer ROCKS!

text: Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours bright ruby red, the white head sporting a touch of pink hue. Cranberry juice dominates the aroma, raspberries, strawberries and cream, vinegar. Smells mostly sweet with some acidity. Flavours are lots of cranberries, tart cherries, rhubarb, red wine and a vinegary, astringent finish. Awesome combination of sweet, sour and some balanced acidity. Medium bodied and unassuming 7%. Cool beer.

750 ml bottle via trade. Pours a mostly clear reddish-gold with a small but resilient off-white head. Aroma of vanilla, cranberry, cherry, raspberry, oak, almond, cream, and faint balsamic vinegar. The flavor follows the same lines, with a lower level of the balsamic kind of acidity I expected from Rodenbach. Light-medium bodied, with medium carbonation and a sweet, jammy, funky, slightly acidic mouthfeel. Really nice and balanced, and maybe tilts a little toward the sweeter than the sour. Very nice beer.

UPDATED: SEP 16, 2014 In 750cc bottle; pours ruby red .. this tasted like ocean spray cranberry cocktail. Very easy drinking .. doesnt taste like beer at all .. overall, nice though not sure I would drink it quite often

750 mL bottle from SoHo Organic Market, Elizabeth City, NC (best before April 29, 2017 according to the bottom of the bottle). Pours deep red with a quick light pink head. Aroma of red berries with notes of apple and oak. The taste is at first shockingly sour but finishes very smooth. For me, the cranberry is the dominant fruit flavor providing plenty of tartness and keeping the beer more sour than fruity. A bit expensive but a great beer.

bottle. hazy, glowing golden red hued beer with a small, loud, light pink head. lots of berry fruits from aroma including strawberries, cherries, raspberry,etc., and some oak with mild sourness and hints of butter/caramel/vanilla. oak and sweet berry flavors dominate. moderate sour intensity. the berry sweetness really helps cut the acidity. moderate/high carbonation that is very fine bubbled and it creates more a creaminess on the palate than an annoying prickly mouthfull. this beer is perfect!....just the right amount of a acidity, sweetness, oak character, carbonation. a fast drinker at 7%...i downed the whole 750 all by my gluttonous self. didnt even fire up my heartburn!
Pours deep red with no head. Heavy fruity, cherries, strawberries, sweet, sour. Flavor is moderate sour with a long duration quite strong notes of cherries, winy. Ends dry

E proprio vero che le cose più buone sono quelle inaspettate, perchè mi è capitata fra le mani per caso questa meraviglia. Qualcosa di fantastico, direi sublime. Qua siamo decisamente ad un passo dallolimpo. Già il suo colore sembra dipinto, poi al naso il sentore aceticolegnoso, che si sposa magnificamente con aromi fruttati delicati, dolci quasi trasognanti. In bocca è da godere, alternando la sua asprezza, con la parte ciliegioamarenosa. Nulla da aggiungere, solo da bere...
Dark red color. Little bit hazy. Fruity aroma. Really wine-like. Medium carbonated body. Taste of grape, cherries, hints of malt. Sour aftertaste

Bottle @ home 20140905. Pours a beautiful deep clear red with a huge pink head. Good head retention. Aroma of raspberries, cherries, artificial candy. Taste of raspberries, cherry pits, cherries, very mild yet pleasant acidity. Some tannins in the end. Wow!

Bottle from CBX. Deep red pour with a pink tinge with a bubbly white head. Big sour cherry and raspberry aroma, cranberries, strawberry purée with oak and funky yeast. Flavor is similar with a mild tartness and a fructose sweetness. Medium bodied, nicely balanced a well put together. Very solid.

75 cl bottle, shared. Pours dirty pink/rust coloured. Sharp cherry acetic nose. "Poepegaatjes" / candyshop. Great fruit aromas, all kinds of berries. Sour taste, citric almost. Very long lasting, taste as well as aromas. Palate never puckering, but very astringent. Had a Rodenbach Grand Cru after this, the contrast proves the quality of this great Caractère Rouge

2014 vintage into a tulip. Pours a hazy raspberry red with a fizzy pink stained head. Nose is sweet overipened berries and lacto. Faint paint thinner/Hawaiian punch thing going on. Taste is puckering berries, sour cherries, cinnamon, light acid, and finishes with smooth oak. Has some of the characteristic flanders traits, but is brighter and juicier. Very delicious, but not overly complex. A nice change of pace over Grand Cru but that price tag is steep.

Bottle from the Dogz place near Pittsburgh. Pricey. Pours dark red with some brownish hues and a bit of light showing through, along with a nice two finger off white head with some pink tones to it. Awesome aroma of cherries and raspberries, lots if sweet fruit here, light tartness, a bit of oak. Flavor is plenty of sourness but not overbearing acidity on the tongue, some oak here but dominated by fruit, sweet raspberries, lots of cherries, and I assume the cranberries add a bit of the tart tones here. Medium bodied with nearly spritzy carbonation that mingles perfectly with the sourness to balance out all the sweet berries here. World class brew.

Flaske delt på brygga med Willy og Steve: Mørkerød, som rødvin, og et meget kortvarig hvitt skum. Aroma av rødvin og sure kirsebær. En usedvanlig øl på mange måter, fantastisk kompleks og intens uten å være påtrengende. Stor smaksdybde, og balansen mellom surheten fra kirsebærene og fatlagringen er i særklasse. Stor takk til Willy som hadde tatt hjem denne helt unike brygget. En i sannhet minneverdig engangsopplevelse..

A dark red colour with very little carbonation and a sour cherry aroma. There was a white head which quickly dispersed. This is a beer of great depth and complex flavours, with an excellent balance between red fruit and a pleasing dryness. Lots of depth to the taste, and a good alcohol content. So much better than many of the fruit beers that I have sampled. A very special brew.

Bottle, batch 2 I believe. Pours beautiful garnet-tinged amber. Aroma: wow. Seedy raspberry, sour apple, kriek lambic, very light balsamic, pleasant tartness, musk. So complex. Taste is sweet and tart cherry fading into sour complexity and sweet malts mingled with sweet and sour jammy raspberry. Soft mouthfeel. Delicious.

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2014 One of the best smelling beers, sour or not, Ive had in a loooooong time. You can pick out each fruit in there (raspberry, cranberry, cherry) and the oak and acidity is present enough to get your attention, but not so much its a distraction. Right in the middle. Medium sour, nice feel...refreshing and super complex at the same time. I could have killed the 750 by myself in record time..."

Old rating rerated 14.08.2014, 0,75l bottle sampled @ Café Sara:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet sour-ish fruity, red berries, mild vinegar, grass, sour-ish candypowder, caramel malts. Taste is slightly sour-ish dry fruity, sorrel, mild vinegar, oak, soda powder, sour red berries, grass, caramel malts. Medium bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Nice.

Poured from a 750ml bottle at home. Aroma is some sweet malt balanced by an acidic cherry aroma. Deep reddish brown, thin head that disappears quickly. Sweet caramel malt that fades quickly into a shard acidic fruitiness, cherry and raspberry come through in the finish. Medium body low carbonation, creamy texture with a dry tart finish. Awesome beer!

Bottle at home from urban tap, Cardiffv reason able £12.50 for 750mlpours deep crimson brown with slight beige lacing and rich aroma of mint, soy sauce, red wine vinegar cranberries and cherry pits. Very fruity shrub like acidity and full bodied complexity of the grand cru. Fairly high carbonation but otherwise easy drinking and tasty.

UPDATED: DEC 28, 2014 Small head, deep golden color. Very fruity aroma. Taste of sweet and sour, underfermented grapes. Slight fizz. Well worth the wait. If you like fruity, sweet wine, youll love this as well.
At the source. The commercial description is misleading, juice rather than fresh fruits seems to be in use. Its a Grand Cru with cherries, raspberries and cranberries. And it tastes like that.

Ruby red body and pretty stable head, for the style especially. Very nice dry raspberry and cherry aroma. Juicy, plucky sourness, fruity, still certainly malty and refreshing enough despite the fruity sugars, especially as the ending is well carbonated still. Delicious! (75cl bottle gift from Cecile and Nicolas, many thanks!)
Aroma of cranberry.Thin or no foam. Taste the same but not the same strong. Transparent body with the red colour of red wine.
Aroma is filled with sun stained raspberries. Appearance beautifully blood orange. Taste is a balanced sour with raspberries and cherries. A very nice drink.
Bomber big thanks to tepp. Garnet with mild carbonation. Tart fruit and tannin aromas. Sweet berries with a perfectly tart finish. Outstanding.
Deep red color, minimal head. Aroma of cranberries, raspberries and slight oak. Taste is a smooth combination of cranberry and raspberry with a drier oak finish. One of, if not my favorite beer.

Shared a 75cl bottle thanks to a colleague. Pours an hazy deep reddish brown colour with almost no head. Berries, grassy, yeast and oak in the aroma. Average carbonation and medium body. Taste is mix of sensations that grows during the tasting starting with some tart notes, passing through sweet fruity flavours and with a sour dry finish. Overall, a beer that makes you think twice about the meaning of the word beer... And takes it to quadrants were the wine usually rules. Very good!

Bottled shared with grogandk. Thanks brah! Pours a cloudy dark brown red. Thin almost clear white shortlasting head. Aromas of raspberry (!), slight mint, grass, some yeast. Taste is very raspberry aswell, very nice fruity sweetness, quite surprised this isn't more sour. Some nice fruity tartness in the end. Grass, yeast, also has quite a minty note to it aswell. Tart dry ending. Pretty high carbonation.
bottleshare thanks to Beechner224. Nose is slightly acetone with some fruit reddish brien color. Taste is much better than aroma. Very fruity, slightly tart. Slightly acidic. Pretty good.
Bottle. Pours a ruby red, white head. Aroma is tart, oak, cherry. Taste is fruity, cranberry, oak, tasty. Nice beer.
Bottle thanks Stacy. Red brunish pour with pink lacing. Aroma full of cherries, cranberries and raspberries. Tart fruit, light cherries and raspberry tones, light spice flavors.
