The flavor is moderately to heavily sweet, moderately to heavily acidic, hint of bitterness. Medium body, velvety texture, lively carbonation, pretty long finish with light bitterness, lightly alcoholic. Very fruity and interesting, although expensive.

Flat white slightly mokka head, brown reddish colour, wine sour fruity cherry oaky wood smell, sour delicate medium carbo a bit dry finish oaky in the finish some fruits(cherry) in the mouth sticky mouth feeling very suprising taste journey in the mouth

Bottle from Roma Italy.Special Thanks to Alberto.Try at Belgrade beer tasting. Pour it reddish pink color with thick white head.Nose smell of raspberry, cherry. Taste and aroma great sour sweetness red fruits.Perfect best of our degustation.Once again thanks Alberto.

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2015 Bottle. Pours clear cobber, fine off-white head. Aroma is tons og fruity berries! Fresh raspberry sweetnees, dry cranberries and sour cherries. Taste is complex of red berries - the best from each compliments the others. Very rich and much like aroma and packed with awesome well balanced tartness. Very oaky and vinous. Fizzy on the tongue and quite sparkling. Dry finish. Really avesome and delicate! Want this for a future wedding!

In Belgrade at a private tasting event. Wow! Reddish colour, vivid and bright. Nose of berries and champagne. Mouth: vinegar, cranberries. Fresh and thirsty quencher. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled from Systembolaget
Deep red/amber with a small head. 
Fruity aroma, mostly raspberries and cherries, along with some wooden notes. 
Sweet and sour flavour; a lot of berries.
750ml bottle pours a dark red amber with an off white head. Big cherry raspberry and cranberry taste. Very enjoyable beer.
Corked 75 cl bottle @ home. Pours clear red with an off-white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour are raspberries, cherries, oak, and tartness - with a slightly tart finish.

Light reddish pour without much head or lacing. Very beautiful tart finish, Rodenback doesnt disappoint. Plum and some very nice sour apple. Great fruit profile. Raisins, sour grapes. Bottle thanks to Shaftie at Epic Sour Tasting.

Bottle shared at DC Annual Epic Sour Tasting, thanks Shaftie! Hazy caramel brown with off-white head. Aromas of jam, cherrie, light funk. Tastes of cherry, dark fruit, light funk. Medium-light body with a dry finish. Pretty tasty.

From a bottle shared at the DC Epic Sour Beer Tasting. Thanks to Shaftie for bringing this classic Belgian sour ale! Pours a clear amber with an off white head. Flavors of sweet plums and tart cherries with a subtle oakiness. Nice.

Color rubí con espuma color crema oscura. Aromas dulces y afrutados de caramelo y frutos rojos con toques ácidos. Cuerpo medio-alto, el sabor es exactamente el que encontramos en la nariz, añadiendo un final seco. Excelente.

Regfrigerated 75 cl brown bottle poured into a tulip. Pours clear medium red with big pinkish beige head. Aroma is red fruit (primarily raspberries), medium body, medium carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is red berries (cherries, cranberries, and some raspberries), tart, and oak. Good beer, but expected a little more.

The aroma is aour cherries, other berries, other tart fruit, sour, vinegar. The appearance is hazy red, off-white head. The flavor is sour cherry, raspberry, tart fruit, vinegar. The finish is tart berries, sour cherries. Medium in body. Very nice. A bit more fruity than sour.

Bottle. The beer pours to a bright ruby orange body with an off-white head. The aroma is cranberry, floral hops, raspberry, and nice yeast created fruit. The flavor is fabulous. Cranberry and raspberry. Tart and acidic. Very delicate even with the sourness. The beer is fabulous.

Bottled. Poured cloudy reddish orange with a short toasted beige head. The aroma picked up lots of tart cherries and oak with nice funk. The flavor found similar, picking up some cranberry.. more tart cherry and oak on the finish. Tart, refreshing, and well-balanced.

Reddish Hugh soapy off white head. Slightly tart cherries a touch sweet as well quite mellow. Palate is well coated a little thin with a lingering tart. Tart cherries some light sweet candied sugars. Mellow and smooth.
Thanks to Jason for sharing.

750ml bottle in a glass. Pours amber ruby with an off-white head. Aroma of raspberries, light cherries, sourness, some spices, dark fruit, and some amber malts. Flavor the same. Average texture. A very good beer.
Backnote, had this beer at the zeebra extreem beer festival 2014. superb beer, red fruit oak sour
Pours a deep reddish color with a small pink tinted head. Notes of berries, oak, vinegar, fresh air, and vanilla. Sour mouthfeel. Bubbly finish.
Tasty Flemish old red. Body of wild sourness, but with some nice fruits to balance it all out.

Bottle. Slightly hazy maroon a with fine-grained offwhite head. Aroma is outstanding with a fruity yeast tartness with cherries, red currants and black currants, as well as balsamic vinegar, oak and some earthy notes. Full velvety body and average carbonation. Flavour is tart with fruity acidity of dark berries, apples and grapes, as well as oaken barrels, giving a light astringent and lingering fruity tart finish.

2011 version slight pink head that disappears quickly. redbrown colour. aroma raspberry, cherry, cranberry, cassis, poepegaatjes. taste like aroma with a sweet-sour balance that is out of this world! medium body and carbonation. words cannot describe how good this really is. buy this, buy all the bottles you can get!! :P
undescribable? A very fruity simple Rodenbach. Best i ever had, at cellar temp, makes the taste even smoother

0,75 l bottle 
floral, barnyard, lots of cranberry/strawberry/rasberry. red, hazy, minimal head, tan foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, heavily sour, medium body, sticky, fizzy, astringent, long finish,

750 ml. bottle. Thanks Mike! Pours a clear bright red with a small pinkish head. Aroma of tart fruit and wood. Taste is tart cherries, raspberries, wood, and funk. Very, very good. Glad I have another one in the cellar.
Red colour, aroma is wood, cranberry and Rodenbach. Taste is the same, not that that is a bad thing.

Bottle 750 ml at home, into a tulip glass. ABV 7%.
Beautiful intense red colour on the body, clear, with continuous activity in the body in the form of small bubbles. Small pink-ish head, froathy, with low reteniton, leaving a small foam island on the surface.
Aroma of cherries, raspeberries, sweet marmalade for a moment, then it changes to a sour one, then again to a lactic one. 
Same on the flavour, intense sour at first with lots of cherries, sour cherries and raspberries, very fruity,with lactic sour notes near the finish. Ends with sweet and sour flavours, very well combined and balanced.
Medium thin body, with good carbonation and very tart palate.
What a great beer!

Bottle at MatSciGuys tasting, not sure who shared it. Pours a beautiful red with no head. Aroma is vibrant fruit, raspberries really shining through. Taste is fruity, tart and soft. Absolutely a great beer.
Bottle shared at LeviLOL tasting. Nice sour nose. Really nice red pour. Cherry and then more cherry and then a soft sourness. Really nice.

Bottle @ skortila, thanks for sharing. Bright dark pink raspberry-esque coloured with a beige head. Nose is raspberries, cassis, cherries. Some light sourness, delicate wood, lots of fruits. Very pleasant. Flavour is slightly sour cherries, funky sourness, lots of fruits, some light malt-based sweetness. Well balanced. This is something different.

Aroma is jammy sweet strawberry and cranberry. Also some herbal peppery minty notes. The flavor is really jammy fruit sweetness. Not very sour, pleasantly tart. Tannins and oak flavor balance it all out. 

---Rated @ your Moms House.

Bottle. Reddish beer with a pinkish head. Cherry and tart aroma with light dust. Big cherry flavor with tartness/sour notes and light acetic. Medium bodied. Nice cherry and sourness lingers with light oak and light acetic notes.

Bottled. 25 cl sample. The aroma has cherries, raspberries, hints of marzipan, oak. This aroma is really fruity, absolutely superb. Bit hazy, red coloured beer, short head. The taste is again very fruity, bit sweet, light-moderate citric sourness, cherries, raspberries, marzipan. Nicely balanced.
Pours a pinkish/red with a pink spongy head that dissipates. Sour cherry, bright fruit, an acidity. Nice mouthfeel, acidic, with some sweetness and a dry finish delicious!
Botella. Cerveza equilibrada con agradable acidez en boca bien combinada con notas de madera e intenso sabor a frutos rojos.

If you want to smell & taste raspberries, cherries, oak, lactic sour this is your beer. Pleasant mouthfeel, a lot going on. Fruity aftertaste that goes on and on and on. This beer is a great fruit beer. To me, one of the best in the world. The first batches were in my experience not spot on. But the second batch is so well executed. Rodenbach for the Nobel Prize!

750 c&c from Knightly in Orlando, FL. Pours quite "raspberry/cherry" color. Slight beige head that might be pinkish. Aroma is delicious cherry. Med body or nearly. Flavor is slightly tart/sour mix of cherries and raspberries. Makes my mouth clench up and twist a bit. Extremely delicious. Finishes like it starts.

Beer 2400. Poured medium reddish brown with a frothy pink head. Aroma of lively raspberry, cremola foam. Medium body, the flavour is sweet raspberry but with a very bitter, tart finish with some hints of wood. Not bad at all, but I dont quite get the hype.

Second batch - the one that recently hit the US. Aroma has a ton of fruit character, mostly cranberry and sour cherry but also some lighter raspberry notes. Light perfume ester character. Light oak notes and medium light acidity; mostly lactic and slightly acetic. Really it is mostly tons of fruit. Pours a cloudy, reddish color with a bit of copper colors and a moderately thick, medium sized, slightly pink head with average retention that steadily recedes to the edges. Faint lacing and medium sized legs. Flavor has a medium light acidity with some moderate sweetness. Light oak notes help provide a bit of a drying character. Tons of fruit character, very juicy and jammy. Lots of sour cherry, cranberry and more raspberry than in the flavor. Hints of alcohol notes. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium high carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. Overall a fairly enjoyable beer with a ton of juicy fruit character and light tartness. I would like a bit more acidity, but the beer is still really nice. A definitely fruit bomb.

Nice. Really reminded me of a nice sparkling rose. Tons of oak and raspberries on the nose. Really really fruity. Would pair nice with strawberry rhubarb crisp. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tasted along side Rodenbach, Rodenbach Grand Cru, and Rodenbach Vintage 2011. Crazy interesting beer that changed dramatically over the course of several hours as it warmed and opened up. The beer started very fruity in both aroma and flavor. The beer had very dominating notes of sweet cranberry and to a lesser extent raspberry. At first this was disappointing as the tartness was mild and overwhelmed by the sweet fruit. It was easily the least interesting beer beteween it, Grand Cru, and Vintage. However, as time went on, Rouge changed greatly. The fruit integrated with more cleanly into the beer. Sweetness mellowed. Tart sour fruit notes emerged. Wood and spice and even some fun earth notes presented themselves. All it a tight sliky package. Most impressive. Would recommend letting this breath or age for a few years.

750ml bottle on tumbler glass. Pours into a reddish copper colour and a very soft, pink, quick to disappear head. Behind the sour aroma, you can feel a soothing hint of red berries. Tastes of red berries, very light hints of oak and has an acidic feel, with it dominating the sour berry aftertaste. Its a shame they only made 900 bottles, but I guess for a beer so good you must use virgin blood and they ran out of it.

Bottle from saveur-biere.com. Beautiful wine like, dark red glowing, slightly hazy body, with small, light pink, creamy head. Delicious, fresh, complex aroma of cherry, raspberry, orange, must, tea, some grains. Taste is fresh, sour, with about the same aromas, also some bready and herb notes. Mouthfeel is medium, creamy, with a lively carbonation and it finishes sour, slightly dry, with lots of berry notes again and some earthy notes. Amazing! Propably the best fruit associated beer Ive had so far, perfectly balanced between sweet and sour, very complex and refreshing!

Bottle shared at Øltorget, february 22nd 2014. Clear red body, small pink-ish head. Aroma of sweet cherries, raspberries, orange. Taste of pretty much same berries with a light tartness, licorice, acidic berry finish. Very good balanced taste, a refreshing sour.

Bottle sample at a sour tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks DSG, Pours red wine like with orange taints and a medium head, aroma of plums, cherries, acidity, vanilla, wood, lots of fruits, raspberries, flavor is sour and refreshing, forest fruits, raspberries, sour plums, medium bodied, great
lekker zuur biertje met een zachte toets van de kersen die eraan toegevoegd zijn

Bottle at the 2014 RBWG, thanks! Pours a deep golden amber with a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has sour red fruit with a bit of acid, funk and light grains. Flavor has more sweet ness with growing sour red fruits that finish with a touch of acid.

Bottle as shown. Pours a cloudy red orange and no head. The aroma is oak, cherry skin, raspberry, and cranberry. Thick mouthfeel with super sweet raspberry and light oak with nice tart finish. Really enjoyed this one!

Very balanced aroma. Sour. Apples. Cherry. Grape. 
Looks amazing. Brownish red. 
Taste is a light sourness a little funky earthy barnyard note on the back. Some oak. Some fruit like cherry. a little light on flavor maybe.
Perfect on the palate. Very creamy, good medium body.

This beer is insane. An expert showing for this style, it being sour and fruity but also with balanced oaky earthy notes. The flavors work in a great synergy and the smooth palate helps to perfect it. Super expensive but totally worth it. Got it as a birthday present then split it for valentines day... thats love!

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2014 Went for it with the $25 price tag. 750ml. Pours a reddish amber with hints of black. Loud nose of sour berries, barnyard funk, and wood. Flavor is Rodenbach but more intensified, with berry elements hidden behind Flanders sour oak vats. Easily the best thing theyve ever done.
Bottle shared at RBWG Room 411 tasting. Pours reddish amber with white head. Nose and taste of very sour cherry, ludens, funk, oak and moderate tart acid. Medium body.

Second Batch
A: Red fruits, Sour Cherry, Raspberry and only slight Cranberry.
Some Funk, which I guess subdues the Cranberry.
A: Ruby red with pink-white head that quickly dissipates. 
T: Sour Red fruits(mostly Cherry and Raspberry), Oak, Vinous notes. Lactic and Acetic sourness. Almost no Sweetness left.
P: Really dry. Not to much carbonation. Could need more body.
O: Really nice one, should habe drunk younger.

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2014 Bottle: Pours a nearly opaque crimson with a brown-ish tint; a layer of off-white foam settles quickly into a chunky, lasting collar. The aroma is lovely... Big sour cherry hits first with tart & sweet raspberry jam following up. Faint lemon, sour candies, & LOTS of warm vanillin from the oak barrels. Dont explicitly get cranberry, but theres a huge berry jam & juicy presence all around, lending both sweetness & sourness. Taste is the same way, sour at first, then flowing into a delicate, finishing sweetness. Sour cherry, raspberry jam, & lemon flesh overload. I finally get some notable cranberry in the mouth coating finish. Slightly vinous at times with an even more robust oak & vanillin presence on the palate. Candy-like aftertaste with a timid kiss of acidity & sweetness. Sharp & carbonated well... Wow, this beer is great. I normally love ass-puckering sourness, but I must appreciate the perfect sour/sweet balance of this beer, allowing the fruit to come out so vividly. Amazing execution.

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2014 2014-01-21. Dark red brown body with a tiny beige head. 3+ Aroma is quite fruity, sweet cherry, lightly syrupy. Flavour is similarly quite fruity, with lots of sweet cherry, light tartness in the finish that I assume is the cranberry but I probably wouldnt pick it out as such without being told. Moderate lactic sourness throughout lingers in the finish. Smooth average plus bodied palate, soft carbonation. Enjoyable. Bottle shared by BlankboyOverheard: "Cause I will be really upset if you misquote me!" - Blankboy
Shared with Wim at his home. Red amber colored beer with small white head and no carbonation visible. Fruited wooden aroma. Full sparkling palate. Finish is rather sour dry. Nice one!
A: Bright red transparent, small head. S: Cherry, fruit. T: Starts sour, goes to sweet raspberry and berry that persists. Lactic and sweet finish. M: Fizzy and pleasant. Dry. O: Excellent.

Bottle from Sugaya shared at my friends Place. A ruby brown pour with a light pink head. Lovely sour fruity aroma of cherries & raspberries. Light body with a sparkling soft carbonation. The taste is a sweet sour berry vibe, sugary & palatable. Very well received by my female friends who dont drink beer. Polished off the whole bottle in one sitting, my overall impression is of sour fruity goodness with a lingering tangy more that tart flavor. Good stuff, amazingly drinkable

Very rare! Very delicious! You can definitely taste the cranberry, cherries and sour cherries.
A tad bit too carbonated! But other than that phenomenal.

Bottle share thanks to mrs. quash. Pours a fairly clear reddish color. Aroma of sour and sweet tarts, berry, raspberry, cherry, and some strawberry notes. Big cherry flavor up front, followed by raspberry with some funky barnyard character mixed in. Some slight medicinal character but not overwhelming. Very tasty.

[My bottle (750ml) shared with HogTownHarry, jercraigs & mabel -- c/o Glouglouburp] Pours a hazy orange-amber with a small lasting frothy off-white head. Aroma of lots of cherries, some wood, some spices, raspberries and cranberries. Nice flavour, lightly tart, with cranberries, raspberries and cherries. some spice and some vinegar. Medium bodied. I really liked this a lot.

Bottle share. Thanks GothGargoyle. Cloudy red, off-white airy cap that settles to a thin film and heavy rope. Aroma of cherry, raspberry, vinegar, wood. Taste is sweet and tart. Sticky mouthfeel. Excellent bitterness, perfect dry finish.

Slightly cloudy red/brown with a good sized pale head. Aroma is cherry, musty cellar, booze, berry jam. Medium-full bodied, nice balance of fruit and sour on the palate. Taste is red fruits, sour cherries, jam. Divine.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours clear red with a alightly off-whtie head. Aroma has sour cherries, raspberries, oak, vanilla. Taste is acidic with tart cherry notes up front, light red berry sweetness follows with some raspberries coming through in the end, tart and refreshing.

Pours a reddish brown, rusty rose color with a finger of gaseous bubbles. The nose has some sweet underlying malt and a big fruit presence, berry forward with a trace of nail polish on the deep inhale but that presence seems to off gas with a little time. The palate is layered with notes of raspberry, cranberry and even a touch of strawberry jam. Nice tannins mingle with some earthy malt and a trace of leather dries out the finish. Jammy and delicious.

The morning after tasting rating. Plenty still left in the bottle. One of downsides of opening a bottle near the end of a tasting. Pours a deep hazy red color with a medium fizzy head. Aroma is very deep juicy cherries and funky effervescence. Like a wild natural cherry soda. Flavor is nicely dry with cherry with a great big burst of tartness and dryness at the end. A great prickly carbonation goes in line with the beer. Very lean and straight to the point. Long ass cherry basement aftertaste. Fucking awesome beer.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: Flaske, købt i Barley Wine. Sjov farve, et sted mellem rav og lyserød. Intet skum, men livlig karbonering. Dufter intenst af blr, ikke mindst hindbær. Masser af bærsødme, og overraskende lav syrlighed til at tackle sødme. Tutti frutti-noter. Blødt træ. Meget nem at drikke. Ikke så kompleks - jeg foretrækker Rodenbach Grand Cru any day.

75cl bottle from Discount Liquor, split with my wife. Pours a clear, reddish brown color with a thin tan head. Aroma is fruity, sour cherry, oak, vanilla. Medium on the palate with soft, creamy carbonation. Flavor is lightly sour, oak, vanilla, some cherry, cranberry, with a nice tart finish. Very nice.

25.4 oz bottle, certainly not batch 1. Clear crimson with edgy white froth. Nose is raspberry, toffee and cherry preserves. Juicy, sticky medium body with a sour tang. Taste is cranberry, sour cherry and vanilla with the raspberry adding sweetness.

Bottle shared with the dudes. Aroma is tart cranberry, sour cherry, oak, and a hint of vinegar. Pours deep red with a small film and decent carbonation. Taste is sweet sour cherry up front, then orange zest, and a clean dry tart cranberry finish. This leads strong and cleans up right away. Just an amazing mouthfeel. Not too sweet, just perfectly balanced. Was a big fan of this one.
together with Yves at my home dark red colored body with a white head and a dark fruit cherry malt aroma a fruity malt bitter sour cherry dry taste with a alcholic bitter finish
Bottle by Cuso, many thanks! App: red liquid, big white foam. Ar: cherry, unusual fruity- candy like taste/aroma. Sour. Very nice beer, I would try this one once more time dedicating it more time :)

Bottle from trade with Countbeer, many thanks my friend. Reddish colored beer with medium white head. Aroma of cherries, raspberries and other red fruit, sourness. Very fruity taste with cranberries, cherries, nice tartness, wood. Long tart finish. Very tasty.
Bottle from Belgisk Bryg. Dark reddish colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of raisins, berries, cherries and sourness.

Poured from bottle courtesy of Cuso. Copper color with white head. Aroma of sour cherry. Sour cherry dominates also in Flavor. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, courtesy of Cuso. Pours redish color, white head. Aroma is sourish, cherry, red fruits, cranberries. Taste is sourish, fruity, cranberries, cherries. Very nice lightly sweet, medium sourish aftertaste. Really nice.
Bottle by Cuso, many thanks! Sour, fruity, refreshing, sour, sour. Excellent! Definitely a great beverage no doubt!

Bottle shared by Cuso. Aroma raisins, strong dried plum. Apparent brett sourness, very tempting. Deep red colour. Taste is plums, cranberries, strong cranberries. Strong, but very bourgois sourness. Delicious. Long dry sour finish. Sour berries at their best.

Wow. Very complex. Aroma is fruity. Smells of cherry et. al. Taste is sour and sweet.

---AJ's Approval

Pours a beautiful soft red. Nice pillowy cherry tinted head. Aroma is of a cherry tart with slight cranberry notes. The raspberries are very, very faint on the nose. When this first hits the palate it comes across as super fruity. Tons of the aforementioned fruits that give way to the classic Rodenbach sour flavor that is compounded with the added fruit. The cranberries, raspberries, and cherries complement this beer perfectly. Definitely in my top 5 favorites..........

from Au Grain dOrge, Cirssier - quite clear reddish beer with a moderate foam; fairly sourish nose, aroma of cherries, wood and other undefined red fruits; full-bodied, assertive and with a solid sourness; fizzy, some initial sweetness; pretty dry and long woody vinegar and red fruity finish (fresh raspberries) - great beer !
Bottle. Wow. Red with a light pink head. Nice sour and fruit aroma. Really sour up front with crazy sour fruit afterwards. Finished really clean. Damn good.

(bottle - corked & caged 750 ml) Hazy red pour with very little foam. Very light fruit aroma with a very nice funky tartness. Cranberry and cherries in the flavor with a fantastic sour funk. Finishes clean and lightly fruity. Outstanding.
Bottled. Pours red with a slight head. Wonderful fruit cocktail aroma. Fruit well integrated, sourness is on the bright side with an appetizing cherry cola like carbonation. Just really tasty.

Bottle at home. Pours clear ruby/garnet with a small, fizzy and bubbly off-white head, short retention, dissipating to the glass edge leaving a mere trace on top of the beer. Aroma is lightly smoky and band aid/medicinal phenols, cranberries, faint acetic notes, tart raspberry, cherry, and strawberry aromas, light earthy cereal malt, imperceptible hops, and some cellar/dust notes underneath. The phenols and berries really dominate the aroma, though swirling opens up the berries a good bit. Flavor is lightly biting and acetic berries (cranberry, raspberry, cherry, strawberry), light peppery phenols, not much of the medicinal/band aid aroma enters the flavor. The earthy cereal malt flavor sits behind the berries and provides support, there is no hop flavor and only the mildest of bitterness which seems more acetic/tart than bitter. Dry and lightly puckering finish with a berry/acetic astringency. Medium body and medium-light carbonation with a faint alcohol warmth.

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2014 Remarkable. This beer is just too close to perfect. Tangy sour aroma and taste is full of cherry and oak.  Lots of fruit in the taste too. Incredibly well balanced. I can?t praise this enough. My first perfect 5.
Bottle with some friends NYE. Pours a hazy reddish brown with thin beige head and spots of lace. Nose of raspberry, strawberry, cherry. Mild tartness, great fruit flavor.

S: Tart rasberries, tart cherries, a little of those cranberries are there as well, light oak, wine, some wet hay and light vinegar towards the end. P: Deep reddish purple with a light white/pink head. T: Initially its sour but those berries do give it a nice sweet flavor. All the berries are well presented, a ton of wine on this one, with a hint of oak and a hint of hay. M: Highly carbonated with a light mouthfeel. It is very sour in the begining but finishes sweet. Wow, what a great beer, it is easy to drink and brings great flavors to the table.

Wow this is awesome. Everything I want in a Sour Red plus more. Its all there slightly yeasty, with a funk and a hint sour cherry in the smell and taste. But you also get an added flavor of mostly tart cranberry with some raspberry. This is a must try if try if you like this style.

Blood red body, thin pinkish-white head, spotty lacing. Sour raspberries and cherries--all fruit. Medium bodied, lively carbonation, a little sweeter than Id like--although not entirely unexpected from Rodenbach.
Bottle pours clear red with low head, aroma is funky berries and oak, taste is nice tart and sweet fruits, awesome

Bottle from Total Wine in Boca Raton, FL. Shared with Edgar and Vanessa. Snifters. Pours a reddish color, clear, with a pinkish-white head. Head lasted a little and some lacing. Aroma is very aromatic with the raspberries and cranberries dominant. A hint of tartness with the cherries and an overall fruity goodness. The taste is just blissful. About as perfect as a sour fruit beer can get. You get all three with the raspberries, cherries and cranberries. It is tart, but not so much it seems acidic or overpowering with yeasts. It is also slightly sweet which brings forth the fruit flavors even more. Tart finish with medium carbonation. Very good.

Bottle. The look is clear, a very light pink off white head, and reddish in color. The smell is tart, cherry, raspberry, fruit roll up, and good. The taste is tart, fruits, cherry, nice, easy, so good. Easy like Sunday morning.
750 mL bottle. Cloudy ruby color with a nice sized off-white head. Aroma is of raspberry, tart cherry, cranberry, sweet florals, and strawberries. Taste is tart, light funk, wood, raspberry, cherry.
Pours hazy blood orange into a snifter. White head quickly recedes to nothing. Cranberry and cherry aromas. Medium bodied with sour cherry and cranberry upfront turning to oak in the dry finish.
75CL bottle at home, Dark red beer with a light red head, aroma is cherry, red fruit, mint. Taste is cherry, raspberry, red fruit, mint, sour, dry. AWESOME beer.
delicious brew. Its got everything, sour, funk, tart, fruit, all in perfect balance. amazing.
Deep amber/red with a cream head. Nose is wood, tart, acidic, cherries, dry, cranberry, and sweet. Great palate, super tart, backed with raspberries, acidic, and a great finish.

translucent red amber with dying cream head, gone fast. Tart cherry, moderate acetic nose, bit of vinegar, light pith. With warmth its rubber band phenols. Flavor is more cherry, arsenic hints and NO acetic, nose deceives, lots of sugary depth with the candy, end is really sweet but balance throughout.

Clear amber orange pour with a thin off white head .... aroma of tart and sour cherries, raspberries and cranberries sweet and tart ...... taste is of dry oak, and dry and tart cherries, raspberries, cranberries and some acidic qualities with a nice sour to it  ..... slight slight hint of sugar .... this is excellent stuff with just a slight hint of carbonation  ... finish is of dry cranberry and oaky .... lovely stuff incredible

Bottle. Poured a red color with an average frothy off-white head that mostly lasted with excellent lacing. Moderate to heavy sweet fruit aroma. Medium to full body with a sticky texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy fruit sweet flavor with a medium to heavy sweet finish of moderate to long duration. This is a standout beer for style.

Bottle as a gift from my brother. Pours red in color with a thick pinkish white head. Aroma of cranberry, raspberry, tannins and a bit of mint. Raspberry and cranberry juice flavor with a sour cherry finish. Good stuff.

Juice-like red color. Light pink head. Nose is of wild cherry hard candy, as are some of the flavor notes. Very sharp and fragrancy fruit flavors, almost perfume-like at times. Unfortunately, there is no malt backbone to give this beer any balance or body. Just sharp and tart. Definitely drinkable, since its a Rodenbach offering, but not nearly as delicious, smooth or well-rounded as the Grand Cru.

Bottle corked and caged poured a deep dark red color with a thin coat of pinkish foam that fell back and retained a ring on the glass. Aroma has raspberry, berry seeds, cherry, and fruit jam sweetness. Nice use of fruits that is somewhat sangria like. Mouth feel is light and the carbonation is medium high. Flavor again has a great fruit display, more of the cranberry comes forward, raspberry, and some light sourness with that unmistakable Rodenbach house flavor. Tart but fruity and very easy to drink.
Pretty tart, but balanced by a noticeable amount of sweetness. Nice red amber color. Delicious, fairly fruit forward. Not crazy funky or very complicated. Good stuff.

750ml bottle, 2013 batch. Pours a clear red with some pink head. Nose is nice, cherry, some candy, some cough syrup, vanilla, woody. Flavor is candy sweet, cinnamon, woody, grassy, tart cherry, some raspberry, some lime. Lightly tart, grassy finish. Very nice.
Bottle @ tasting. Aroma is very fruity, tons of red fruits, a bit tangy, faint liquorice. Flavour too. With some burned caramel.

75cl bottle, thanks craftycarl21. Medium pink head atop lightly hazed red body. Aroma is moderately sweet, cranberry, some funk, tart, light wood. Taste is moderately sweet, cranberry, some cherry, tart, light funk. Medium body, light stickiness.

Bottle thanks to Ed at Churchkey!!! Hazy rich red mahogany pour. Nose and flavor bring stunningly complex dark fruit including cranberry and blackberry with vinous notes and balanced tartness. Insanely drinkable. Excellent. 

12/13/13- didnt realize Id rated this. Cinnamon cherry, vanilla, vinous. Really really good.

Shared bottle at Kulminator. Clear red golden body with an apricot glow and a small dense light brown head. Super inviting raspberry marmelade and fresh black berries on the nose. Mouth adds light fresh berries, hints of apple cider vinegar and black currant. Light to medium bodied with an overall mellow, balanced and smooth impression. Light notes of corn flakes in the finish. A true masterpiece.

Wow, this might be the best looking beer Ive ever seen. Its a hazy slightly pink/rosey red color with a small and fizzy, very light pink head that is almost white. There is a surprising amount of musty and grassy funk on the nose, very tart smelling, kind of that balsamic vinegar tart Rodenbach is known for, I can mostly smell the cranberries, the cherries and raspberries seem to blend together somewhat, and a nice subtle oak note. Wow, this beer continues to blow me away. Sweet raspberries up front, lots of bright red berry taste, the fruit seems to cut the sourness away quite a bit, though there is still plenty of that patent rodenbach balsamic vinegar sourness, a nice oaky taste, and a nice bit of barnyard funk. Wow, what an astounding beer. So refreshing and delicate, not overly sweet, and very smooth.
750 ml bottle shared by Tmoney99. Pours a hazy reddish color with a large pink head. The aroma and flavor have big fruity notes, oak, raspberries and cherry, tart lightly acidic, very good.

Bottle , rating #5000. Pours dark red eith a fast dissipating off-white head. Aroma of fruits, cherries, raspberries, some mint, oak and sour notes. Flavor is sweet and sour with some fruitiness, raspberries, oak, mint, malt, grapes and raspberries. Medium body, average carbonation. World class .
Words cant really describe this beer. Incredible aroma, incredible flavor--you taste cranberries and cherries, and just the right amount of sour.

750 ml bottle to snifter (2012 vintage; shared with the Mrs,). Looks good; a semi-transparent deep cherry with foamy light pink head that steadily dissipates into lacing. Smells solid; tart, fruity, and a touch funky. Tastes like it smells, only more robust.  Pleasant on the palate. Enjoyable.

Slightly hazy red pour with a pale pinkish head that slowly fades down to a film. Great lacing. Great aroma filled with cherry, raspberry, wood, and a hint of vinegar. Taste is very tart berries, slight vinegar, faint oak. Really nice tartness. Slightly acidic. Dry on the palate. Great beer. Really enjoyable.

Put down some real money to try a real beer this evening. Look, this is no joke. Caractere Rouge is exceptionally well-balanced; it strikes the right balance of tart fruit, lactose, and smoothness. A pleasure to drink, but I will have to run the finances again for re-purchase at $20 / 750ml bottle.

UPDATED: APR 12, 2015 Re-rate 3/15: Bottle sample at a tasting at Maxs place. Thanks Stas & Vova. Hazy red-brown. Aroma of cherries, berries, oak, cellar, lacto and wood. Sour-sweet flavor, full of juicy cherries and berries, a bit of caramel, some lemon, oak, and some funk. Medium-bodied. Great. 8/4/8/4/17=4.1

Bottle shared at a sour tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Red color, slightly brownish, with orange hues.Great aroma full of cherries, some berries, oak, lactic notes and a bit of caramel. Lovely sweet and sour flavor, kinda lactic, full of cherries, berries, oak and a funky finish. Rounded mouthfeel. Really delicious. 8/3/9/4/17=4.1

Bottle from MotherBrother...thanks Peter! - Pours reddish with no head. Nose is a mix of cranberry, raspberry and cherry--nice. Tart but not sour. Taste is pretty heavy on cranberry and raspberry with an accompanying tart pale sourness. Thin, with medium carbonation.

This is only the 3rd sour or so Ive had, but this could be the one to get me into them. Medium clear cranberry color with a very thin head that remains. Does not taste Like a beer but feels like one to drink. Each of the cranberry, cherry, and raspberry flavors are easily found and very prominent. The motufeel is dominated by the tannins from the oak barrels which gives it that stinging and tart feel. Almost sweet like a soda for a second with all the fruit flavors then the sour takes over with the sting. I cant really yell the hops and malts because I am not really familiar wiith sours. This was really enjoyable like a good wine.
750 ml from The Beer Trappe. Deep red color. Red wine. Vinegar. Sour cherry tart. Big fruit nose and taste. Excellent. Enjoyed with 2013 smoked turkey for T-Day.

Bottled 750ml PBFVIII
Deep red color, small white head. Cherry, cherry stone aroma. Medium-bodied. Cherries, fruity, some tartness but much fruitier than normal Rodenachs.

Bottle. Sparkly cherry and cranberry aroma, a littlebit sour raspberry fizz candy. Hazy neon ren, offwhite ring. Medium body, dry, sparkly. Fruity base - the berries are distinguishable, the cranberry and taspberry tartness and dry palate carries it into a sparkly dry finish. Tart cherry aftertaste. Very very easy to drink.

Belgian Version.
Aroma: Fresh Raspberries, Mild Cherry

Appearance: Ruby Red, Passes Some Light, Pink Head, Some Lacing

Taste: Fresh Raspberries, Strawberry, Mild Cherry

Mouthfeel: Average Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Fruity, Mildly Tart

UPDATED: NOV 24, 2013 Bottle from tommy, Thanks man!! Red fizzy pour, what an aroma, cherries, fruit, slight acidic. Wow this has a some serious drinkability. Wonderful mix of fruit, slight acidic, all in a perfect balance.

UPDATED: NOV 24, 2013 Bottle - Various sweet red berries but not too sweet. Orange red cloudy with a thin pink head. Cherry acidic sweetness, followed by a nice bitterness, finishing sweet again. Not typical, sweet but good.

750ml bottle, shared by Nate F. Mostly hazy red orange color. Thin off-white, sort of pink hued head. Loose ropes of lace slowly slide back into the body. Awesome big cherry, raspberry fruit aroma, light wood flavor. Fruit flavor is New Glarus -level good. Almost refreshing even, super tasty. Nice light tart taste, moderate sweetness, light dry oaky tingle. Smooth, crisp lighter carbonation. Medium-plus body, with a syrupy stickiness in the finish that I dont really mind here. Fantastic stuff, so tasty!

From the November 2013 3R6P tasting. +++ Sampled from a 750 ml brown bottle this beer poured a bright red-amber color with a medium sized foamy pink head that left a bit of lacing. The aroma was tart and funky cherry and berry. The flavor was tart and sour cherry, berry, a bit of vinegar and yeast. Medium length finish of tart and sour cherry and berry. Moderately full bodied. Interesting.

Bottle from whole foods. Pours fairly clear red with a small head. The aroma is loaded with tart cherry, raspberry, and you do pick up the cranberry. The taste has a ton of tart fruit. The cranberry dominates for me but the cherry comes out on the finish. Delicious.

Pours a clear ruby/amber with a medium white head. Aroma has nice fruity notes of cherry and cranberry...just a slight tart/acidic note. Flavor has awesome cranberry, nice and tart/sour with cherry creeping in. Mouthfeel is light and silky with a dry tart cranberry finish...fabulous.
Bottle (Batch 2). Poured a mahogany-ish color with a smaller sized tannish head. Berries, cherries, more berries, and some read wine.

Murky red brown color with a medium sized, light tan head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of cherries, leather, vinegar, pie crust, red wine, and wild yeasts. Taste of the same, cherries, red wine, cranberries, raspberries, and a sour cherry finish.

Aroma brings a sweet medley of fruity sodas including cranberry and cherry. Pours bright pinkish amber with a white sandy pinkish head. Flavor brings some sweet and tart berries settling so smooth in the palate. It is not too dry, with just the right amount of juiciness.
Ruby with tiny white head. Nice tart red fruit aroma. Flavor is a bit jammy with red fruit. Nice but not much better than reg rodenbach.

Bottle. Gorgeous ruby/brown pour with a pink-tinged head. Aroma is tart fruit, cranberries and some great Flanders funk. Fruit is dominant. Flavor is tart cranberries, raspberries linger in the back and there is just a hint of cherry sweetness all surrounded by a beautiful Flanders Red base. Phenomenal beer.

750 cc shared by me at CAH. Pours hazy ruby with minimal head. Nose is complex multi-layered fruit, with predominant cranberry and cherry. Tastes tart, fruity, with notes of oak, lactose, vanilla, and mostly cherry THEN cranberry, with finishing lactic tartness. This one is delicious.
Fantastiskt gott. Smak och doft av hallon, smultron, körsbär. Lagom syrlighet i kombination med ekträ och rödabär. Välbalanserad och lagom söt. Elegant och harmoniskt i gommen. Mer av detta tack.

bottle, from Triangle Wine. Good aroma, sweet, fruity. I get raspberry the most, with cherry and cranberry. Tad hazed brownish red color, good initial head, faded to a ring. Sweet tart flavor. Light body, thin sticky mouthfeel, sweet finish. pretty nice, not sure if it was worth the price, around 20 bucks. but nice fruity aroma, sweet tart flavor,good beer
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: UPDATED: MAR 27, 2017 750ml bottle. Shared with Andrés Lúpulo. Caramel, berries, tart aromas. Pours reddish with vanishing off-white head, poor lacing.Light body, average carbonation, oily texure. Taste is cherries, berries, caramel, some tartness.

Flaska från SB. Rödrosa vätska med doft av smultron, tranbär, hallon, körsbär, hallonbåtar. Försiktig syra, mycket elegant och lätt, fruktig och bärig, lätt fatkaraktär. Otroligt god. Tänker på Hanssens Oudbeitje som närmaste referens i elegans och finstämd bärighet. En upplevelse.

Bottle from Utobeer Borough Market. Holy cow this is the promised land. Massive cough sweet aromas, fizz jumping around, cherry, berry. Then bang the mouthfeel and taste just explode in the mouth. Very refreshing cold, as zingy on the palate as a 15 year old virgin, with a whoop of tartness and coldness and fruitiness. Not a massive fan of fruitier beers, but this is just so so good.
Cherries, raspberries, and a slight sour lambic-ish note. A really good beer!

Bottle, shared by Ryan -- thanks! Aroma of cherry, raspberry, and more cherry. Fragrant, perfumey fruit. Beautiful ruby red, clear, no meaningful head. Cough syrup slick, lots of sweetness with a nice tart "finish", followed by more syrupy sweetness after the tartness subsides, but it works. It works great. Medium body, slick texture, soft carbonation. Really nice.

Bottle shared with Brandon at his 70s style chapel hill home. Pours a
lightly sparkly plum reddish pink with a steady fizzy white head and remaining lace. Nose is heavily fruity upfront, followed by some more tart red fruit skins. Really nice and well balanced fruity tart flavor, cranberries are evident along with cherry and raspberry. One of my favorite rodenbachs since I had Alexander!

Bottle. Thanks Patrick. Sour tart sweet. Little of everything. Best thing is it's not super tart like some sours. Mellow for its class. Has a hint of cherry cough drop smell. Nicely done. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From 0.75L bottle. 

Pours redfish with light pink head. Cherry/raspberry aroma. Sweet-tart flavor. May be fine for candy, but not my cup of tea for beer. 

Low rating due to style, not execution. 
 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Systembolaget.
Ar: fruit to the rafters, cherries, raspberries, strawberries, acidic, tart, makes me saligare, vanilla. 
Ap: slightly hazy red colour, medium pink head.
T: big acidity, mid-sweet, ABV noticable.
P: medium body, lively carbonation, tart finish. 
O: enjoyable.
Fruitbomb. Raspberries and cherries are prominent. Hint of strawberries. Sour and dry with a full and red fruitiness as backbone. Wood noticeable but not at all prominent. Excelent beer.

Pinkish-red pour. Aroma is a nice mix of the fruit used with sour cranberry/raspberry prominant early that trails off to sweet, floral cherry, vanilla, and light oak. Flavor follows suit with a nice solid sour cranberry and raspberry that finishes with gentle cherry and vanilla. Moderate sour with some "life" to it. Fairly straight-forward with some sweeter aspects. Refreshing and not syrupy. Very nice overall, but expensive.

Rosa til rød farge. Fin rosa skumtopp. Fruktig og tyggegummiaktig aroma. Syrlig og meget fruktig på smak. Tydelig bærpreg. Fantastisk god aperitif.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

.75l bottle @ Vihreä Haltiatar 
Pours clear cherry red with low head. Aroma is vinegar, red berries ex. cherry, bubble gum and wine. Flavor is red berries, cherry, vinegar, malts. Swell!
Pours a reddish orange or brown with a light pink head. Prominent berry notes, cranberry, raspberry and cherry. Incredibly fruity. Finish tart, but not very sour
UPDATED: DEC 29, 2013 Bottle at WTWBA. Hazy reddish orange pour with a white head. Very fruity - raspberry - some tart. Delicious.

Pours dark cherry color with small off-white/pink head that bubbles beautifully when swirled. Aroma strong of sour cherries, sweet malty notes in background. First sip is very strong cherry/cranberry sourness with very smooth carbonation. Finish is quick and refreshing. After warming up a bit, can taste the body behind the fruit. Fruit-forward beers tend to be thin, but this beer is full and balanced yet still easy to drink. Good stuff, glad I was able to grab a bottle!

Bottle thanks to Tommy. I love this beer. Tons of juicy fruit with nice ripe berries and cherries. The back end is a very inviting bright tartness with enough malt to keep it interesting. Just a phenomenal beer.
This beer is unbelievably fruity. Gushing with sweet cherries and lightly tart raspberry, mild tartness, awesome and well-balanced.
Bottled 75cl. Deeply pleasant and dangerously drinkable. Again a beer with dandelion reminiscence in the finish.

Bouteille de 750ml, avec bouchon de liège, partagée lors dune dégustation Ratebeer Montréal. Arôme: Légère odeur de cerise et de framboise. Apparence: La couleur est rouge opaque. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de cerise sûrette avec une pointe de framboise et de vanille. Longue durée de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement vineuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement sûrette. (Rating #5091)

750 ml bottle 2013 vintage. 
Pours a dark garnet red with full pinkish head. 
Bright Aromas of strawberry jam and cherry pie
Flavours of dark cherries, light wood, and strawberries. Very fruity. Like a barrel aged cherry cider. 
Wonderful balance, very light tartness
Wow this is completely amazing, tons of fruit flavors, and a tart sharp flavor that blends excellently, holy shit!

750ml bottle (One Pint Pub, Helsinki) - shared by mjs - thanks!
Lovely light (not heavy) dark berry aroma - raspberry first, then maybe aged blackcurrent jam. Nice hazy red, persistent loose off-white head. Lovely sharp crisp palate, touch acidic but not harsh. Aged wood ester retronasals. Lovely sour red base, and the fruits are clear but not dominating. Gentle sweetness makes this highly drinkable, no harshness at all. Classic sour fruity ale. More fruitiness in the finish. Happy memories in the late finish.
Bottle 0.75l at One Pint Pub, Helsinki. Colour is red with very small white head. Aromas and flavours: Berries, raspberries, sweetness and sourness.

(Bottle, 0.75 l, at One Pint Pub, 201309013) The beer poured reddish brown and quite clear. Its head was medium sized and pinkish. Aroma had sourness, cherries, cherry stones, raspberries, berries and Belgian style yeast. Palate was medium carbonation and dry with medium carbonation. Flavours were cherries, raspberries, sourness, berries, malts and bitterness. Afteraste had berries and bitterness. An interesting and pleasant combination.

Deep red/brown colour, quite bright with quickly dissipating low pink head. Raspberries, cranberries and cherries in the nose. Good balance between sourness and fruit, although probably on the sweet side for my taste but still enjoyable. Light body, well carbonated, lingering sour/sweet finish. Nice stuff.

750ml bottle from IPB.
Appearance : Clear amber-red with small light pink head. Light lacing.

Aroma : Lactic sourness with cooked cherries. Light cough syrup notes. Hot cherry pie, some funk, light wood. Light raspberries maybe. Light acidity from cranberries maybe. Some tartness.

Taste : Lactic sourness with sharp acidity. big cheery pie. Light raspberries. Light funk. Finish cherry pie with light funk, light wood and light vanilla.

Overall : Fairly nice fruity notes. Nice persistent fuity finish. Classic Rodenbach sourness. Really nice looking. More acessible for me than Rodenbach Grand Cru but Im still not a Flanders Red fan. Well made, nice stuff, just not my thing.
Bottle at my place with group. Pours beautiful deep rose red. Taste is raspberry cherry. Hint of cough syrup. Finish is medium and smooths out. Pleasant beer. A little acidic.
Oklar röd-orange med litet lätt färgat skum. Doft: Gele hallon shot, vinäger, trä, äppel kart, jäst, äppelmust. Smak: Vinäger, gele hallon, citron syra, omogna hallon.

How I enjoyed this bottle! I was a bit sceptic when I bought it, but what was I wrong. From the first taste, I immediatly enjoyed the sweet sour flavour. Its colour is simply magnificent. A perfect red brown beer.

UPDATED: NOV 26, 2013 Så oerhört vacker! Vet inte vad jag hade väntat mig, något grumligt brunt kanske men det här var ju helt otroligt vackert. Härliga bärsmaker med fin balans mellan syra och sötma. Lever helt klart upp till mina enorma förväntningar jag hade. Världsklass och perfektion. Men två år på fat alltså. De känner man inte så mycket av. Undra varför...

Rerate: fortfarande värdsklass och passar på att köpa fem flaskor till. Dom kommer gå åt. Men varför i hela friden har man århundradets sämsta kork på en så pass fin och välgjord öl? Den här lilla fjanten kommer inte stå pall tidens tand speciellt många år. Planen att spara några flaskor till pensionen spricker ju nu pga en dålig kork. Ajaj

------- en 2011a på Kulminator och den känns ju oerhört lik. Vågar mig inte på att påstå att det är skillnader om jag inte har dom parallellt.

Light red. Small head. Raspberry rules. Cranberry/cherry yes if you know it. Very fruity. Complex. Great tart-dryness.
wonderful beer , fruit is well balanced and blended perfectly with everything else.

75cl bottle enjoyed in São Paulo. I was very excited to try this and I had hyped it up in my own head for some time. This might have been the reason I wasnt completely blown away by it. My bottle was filtered and pasturised which stripped the depth of flavour and aroma. Both the flavour and aroma where on the sweeter side of sour. The sugar is certainly more dominant than the refreshing sour aspect. Plus with the lack of alive yeast to eat those sugars its not going to change the sweetness with age. Still a great beer but in my opinion its not quite up there with the best.

Bottled, large sample. Slight hazy reddish color, short frothy head. Aroma is very fruity of raspberry and cherry, hint of oak, some marzipan, hint of tartness. It starts quite sour, but then also some fruity sweetness comes. It seems like a blend of a Flemish Red and a Oude Kriek. Its not as sour as both can be, as the fruits bring a lot of fruity sugary sweetness with them. Very nice beer, though the balance was not optimal as it cannot decide whether it wants to be a Kriek or a Rodenbach.

750 ml bottle @ PBF 2013.
Pours a beautiful dark amber colour with a bright ruby hue. Aroma is very, very rich with raspberries, rosehip, lingonberries and some mild citrusy notes. Flavour is rather strong and tart with raspberries, rhubarb, lingonberries, tart lemon juice, fluor, deep red cherries, bubblegum and strawberries. Full bodied, tart dry mouthfeel and a long lingering tart, berryish, dry finish. Incredible fruitiness accompanied with Rodenbach tartness. So good.

75 cl bottle @ PBF 2013.
Pours slightly hazy red color with a small head. Aroma of sour berries, grape fruits and grass, some rose hip also. Flavor of rose hip, cherries, goose berries and cherries. Very tart and tasty.
3356

UPDATED: SEP 3, 2013 
75 cl bottle @ PBF VIII
Aroma is quite light with some cherries and sour notes. Also some slight tart feeling and fruit candy. Flavour is quite tart with lots of berries, some cherries, oaky notes and juice. One sour berry juice.

Bottled at PBF.  hazy copper/amber, minimal head. Tart woody cherry/raspberry aroma. Dryish with woody vinegar and light-medium body and rounded mouthfeel. Cider vinegar and sour wood, slight red berries. Not as deep as most Rodenbach versions.

750ml bottle @ PBF 2013 from Systembolaget

Pours dark reddish with a small white head. Aroma of sour cherries, berries, tartness, fruits, hints of spices and yeast. Taste is sweetish, sour and tart with notes of cherries, berries, ripe fruits and yeast. Finish is sour and sweet with notes of sugar, berries, ripe fruits and hints of cherries. Quite sweet and sour red ale.

Big bottle from SB cons 2013-08-22 Göteborg
AR: tart sour red berries, german kriek, wee vanilla
AP: wee hazy bloody red, frothy pinkish steady head
F: kriek, cranberries, raspberries, tart, sour, hard carbonation, medium high bitternees,

750mL. Pours hazy, beautiful Pinkish red but deep near rhubarb or reddish purple. Pink foam. Nose is fairly phenolic, pretty intense on green olive brine, Taste is salty, mildly acetic, quite leathery, lots of fresh raspberry and cranberry. Bright overall with a wickedly quick finish. Nice, but the mega phenol nose is distracting. As it warms, that leathery, bright, quick palate is getting better and better.
Rubinröd, lätt dimmig öl med lätt rosa skum. Mycket frukt i både doft och smak, framförallt hallon men även tranbär och körsbär. En bra kombination av fruktsötma och vinägersyra.
i really like this beer, very nice red colour, a little sour and a nice tast of cranberries

75 cl bottle at Systembolaget. Never thought Id rate a sour beer this high. A relly nice one for its type. Very nice sourness and not to stale. Very nice refreshing fruitiness. Conclusion: A really nice sour beer that definetly make me more interested in the style, to which Im otherwise a bit sceptic

Bottle 75 cl from Systembolaget. Red/ruby with quickly dissipating pinkish head. Lots of raspberries, very nice balance in the sourness (not too sour), slight strawberry, cherries, quite a bit of cranberries. Light body, quite carbonated, long soursweet finish, refreshing. Very nice!

Bottled:Beautiful red colour. Small, pink head. Tart aroma of strawberries and raspberries. Sweet and sour flavour of strawberries, cherries, raspberries and oak casks. Pretty good, but i would prefer less sweetness and more tartness.

Fruchtiger Antrunk der säuerlich startet und dann deutlich süßer wird. Süffig, die Süßung ist dann zu stark und stört etwas. Fruchtnoten nach Kirsche und vor allem Himbeere. Zum Ende leider zuckrig, trocken. 11/11/12/10/12/10
Doften är frisk med stora toner av hallon, körsbär samt små inslag av aceton. Smaken är relativt syrlig med toner av hallon och körsbär. Härlig eftersmak.

Sweet scent. The taste is really good cherries. The aftertaste is left long and is really good but still a bit sour. An impressive beer. Worth a try! Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Bottle from Systembolaget. Sour and fruity smell and taste with berries, cherries and almonds. Very nice, tart and fruity. Great beer.

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2014 from notes. i thought it was batch 3. shared bottle. pours a dark ruby color with a red/white head. lots of fruit in the aroma. cherry, rasberry, sour vinegar notes. a lot of cherry and fruitiness in the taste. hints of the oak and some vanilla. 

re-rate this. got it some more times and this is by far my favourite sour red. the full flavour of cheries raspberries cranberries en more red fruits are so balanced with the sour notes. my perfect summer beer

Bottle, started at 8C which was far too cold. Murky red brown with a pink head that rapidly dissipates for the first glass, but lingers a while for the restoppered second. Aroma of cherries, cranberries, almonds, light spices, damp wood. Medium to light bodied with a slight slipperiness. Quite carbonated. Sweet, then tart and pretty acidic with a woody and spicy finish. Lots of berries. Theres both a punchy and a brooding side to the sourness - aided by the cranberry and cherry respectively I suppose, but its all very seamless. Then the fruit vanishes. Spices - white pepper, some tobacco, Sichuan pepper - linger indefinitely.

UPDATED: SEP 15, 2015 Flaska @ Systembolaget. Brunröd vätska med ett skum som avtar snabbt. Intensiva dofter av körsbär, hallon och med en avrundning av stall. Fruktigt, bärigt i smaken. Tranbären dyker genast upp och balanserar med sin syrlighet. Slutligen avrundas smaken med torra inslag vilka påminner om hö eller läder. Komplex på ett bra vis.

Bttle. Frothy White good mostly lasting head. Red colour. Moderate malty and light hopy nice sour aroma. Week kriek notes. Light sweet and moderate bitter nice sour/kriek flavor. Long wonderfull finish. Creamy palate.

Red color with just a small pink head. Very sour, fruity aroma with raspberry, cherry along with some sweet red candy. Lovely taste of red berries with some cherry, raspberry and strawberry notes. Somewhat sweet, but very nice to sip on a beautiful summer night.

750 ml "champagne" bottle, Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. ABV is 7%. Red colour, large pink head. Strong sourish-fruity aroma of ripe red berries (= cherries, raspberries and cranberries), also notes of oak and farmhouse. Lovely clean sour & fruity flavour with a strong presence of said berries, some sweetness but not too much. Refined and interesting, but still refreshing and easy drinking for its strength and age.

My Bottom Line:
Cherries, red cranberries and raspberries take on flowers and bubblegum in this delightfully tart and bubbly brew.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A veil of foam covers the cloudy red.
-A spiciness is also present, redolent of cinnamon and cardamom at times. Must be the sour cherries doing.
-The aroma is truly compelling.
-The fruitiness is exuberant but never boring.
-All flavors are well rendered and polished.

Bottle.

Bottle at home with Jess. Pours deep dark red with quickly dissipating tan head. Aroma is piercing raspberries up front and some of the classic acetic Rodenbach character comes through as well. Taste is similar, immediate raspberry flavor followed by a more pronounced flemish red profile. Get some oakiness as the beer lingers on my tongue. Palate is average, somewhat nondescript. Finish brings more intense acetic sourness and a little caramel to support that. Its not often these days that I drink Flemish red/brown ales as several American examples of the style have been monster aceto-bombs that are a disgrace to beer (looking at you Dark Horse Lambeak Wants Blood Orange). Really enjoyed this relatively new offering; the fruit works very well here. Would love to have more regular access to this one.

Bottle from Belgium in a Box; dark ruby pour with big fluffy pink head, big tart aroma of raspberries and cherries, the fruit action really come through in the taste raspberries, cherries backed up with beautifully balanced sourness, absolutely delightful beer. Hope to have again.
Red amber color with light pink foam. Aroma of red berries. Taste of cherry, raspberry but also the slightly bitter dry towing of the cranberries. Sour vinegar-like aftertaste.

Bottle from Dranken Geers, about a year ago consumed at home in company of Traci & Casey 7.07.13   Pours wondeful cherry or vimto red with a ligh pinkish head. Great zappy fruity aroma, plenty of sour berries. This is marvellous on the mouth, incredibly not as sour as I expected, wonderful balsamic touches, some cherry, not sure that I get the cranberries however they clearly change the characteristics of this beer. I really like this, I like Rodenbach but it isnt always a beer that I would drink one after the other of, this bucks the trend its a moreish beer, I like it!  A8 A4 T8 P4 Ov17 4.1

Bottle 75cl, an amber red beer with a medium pink head. Nose is very intense on red fruits, seems sweet like ! Aroma is dry quite acid, body is less complex as expected with lot of red fruit notes, light lambic touch, monodimensional on my point of view, moshroom note.

Ratebeer Gallery event bottle share (thank you!): 
Brown with cherry red edges and gorgeous beige frothy head. Vibrant berry aroma. Theres red fruit and berries on the nose with red-licorice candy and some plums puctuated by lactic sourness and some funk.Plush medium-bodied mouthfeel leans out toward a prolonged finish of jamminess. Amazing.

750 ml. bottle at the Ratebeer gallery event. It pours a really lovely deep ruby red color with a pinkish head. The aroma is all about the fruit. Big time tart cherry, raspberry and cranberry. Some sweet jamminess to it as well. Very mild funk and wood. The flavor is the same. Amazing fruit blend with the tartness really jumping out at you before settling in to a nice sweet fruity, funky finish. One of the standouts of the night.

From bottle share at Ratebeer Gallery event. Pours reddish brown with a modest pinkish brown head and a sour fruit aroma. There is a sweet cherry flavor (Schaerbeekse?) that turns a bit sour at the finish. This is a great tasting brew.

Pours a clear ruby-shaded mahogny body. Tall pink-hued blond top. Initial aroma of a gently rounded acetic and lactic adcids. Then the berries kicks inn. Freshly crushed raspberries, tart sappy cherries, some floral notes, and a nice touch of peppermint. Delicious! Full body and complex, with armloads of inviting flavors. Berry-o-rama! Fresh and tart, sour and sweet. Nice subtle malt backbone. What a treat! [Shared bottle at Haandbryggeriet tasting session, thanks to Gustav J for sharing]

750 ml bottle. Pours a deep red with a pink head and lacing. Aroma is big fruit and sourness. I get a lot of cherry and raspberry. Tastes of bright, fresh, sour fruit juice. So good! Side note, I had this following New Glarus Serendipity. The ideas behind the beers are very similar and it showed in the end products. This beer is very much like a sour version of Serendipity. It really takes it to a whole new level.

750mL bottle, sent from Glouglouburp (thanks a lot, Dany), pours a deep dark amber / mahogany with a medium off-white head. Aroma is extremely potent berries, especially raspberries, with some moderate wild yeast, and a touch of sweetness. Flavour brings out intense raspberries and cherries, a light tartness and more fruitiness as mentioned. Intensely complex, featuring both aforementioned fruits. So highly drinkable and intensely fruity. Awesome - as good as Alexander.

Bottle. Hazy reddish liquid with small light pink head. Aroma of lemons, cherries, raspberries, apples, barnyard, grain, bread and wood. Taste is dry to light sweet and medium sour with notes of lemons, raspberries, cherries, wood and apples. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Nice stuff, lots of berries.

Finally the long search and wait are over. Here it is, guessing this is the latest batch, so I might have tasted it to young, but luckily got some cellared.
I do have the feeling it was a bit young but here we go anyways:
A 75cl bottle served in both a Chouffe glass and an old Belle-Vue Gueuze glass just for me.  :)
Medium to smaller sized, lively and quickly changing vanilla pink ish colored foamy head. Leaves some bubbles/very small islands on top of a light hazy amber red colored beer.
Aroma has loads of red fruit, strawberry, cherries, raspberry, cranberry, oak, hint of yeast, light vinous, crispy, hints of grainy malts and corn.
Flavours of first very red fruity, than yeasty and than more sour: yeast, caramel, oak, brown sugars, cherry, cranberry, bitter, more sour, wood hints of grains, light spiced and malts.
Aftertaste has a yeasty wood ish undertone with some fruit tones, sourness, malts and citric herbs.
Crisp and clean sourness.
Low carbo, sprinkly first than right away a creamy mouthfeel, medium to lightly fuller body and a creamy texture.
I think as I mentioned before that this beer is still a bit young, but after letting it breath for about an hour the beer becomes more balanced but still not optimal. A stronger sour touch which start fruity and ends sour that it seems to make the body a bit unbalanced and not thin but a bit thinner... Its a decent beer and am curious to taste another one in about 2 years to see what it has lead up to.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Small sample. Big thanks to Ryan for giving me a small taste of this. Rodenbach sours have always been great but this one just goes to a different level. Great sour tartness without a ton of vinegar flavor to it. Just straight up awesome.

Bottle. Thanks Tommy! I can summarize my review in pretty quickly if youve ever tasted Cherry Blaster candies. Liquid Cherry Blasters. 

Poured a lovely ruby red colour with a small pinkish head. The Rodenbach vinegar nose is there straight away with a cherry and raspberry aroma hot on its heels.A wet woody smell in there too making it quite mouthwatering. The cherry and raspberry taste comes through at first and is followed swiftly by a woody vinegar like flavour making a fantastic sweet and sour taste.The berry taste remains quite strong in the aftertaste along with the sourness,great. Great beer

(bottle) pours a hazy ruby-amber colour with a frothy light pink head. aroma of strawberries, prawns, raspberries and caramel, with a light hint of gravy. flavour is very sweet, with big notes of bubble gum, strawberries, caramelized malts and a slightly lemony tart finish. medium-bodied with lively carbonation.

Bottle courtesy of Jay. Pours a red body with thin carbonated, off white bubbly lacing. Aroma is sweet candied fruit, raspberries, cherries and light tart. Mouthfeel is medium to thin with a nice carbonated feel and nice combination of cherries, raspberries and strawberries. This almost reminds me of New Glaruss Serendipity. Very nice.

75cl bottle. Batch 2012 (second batch).
Appearance: small unstable head, clear red beer.
Nose: "coulis", red fruits, berries, very sweet, little sourness already noticeable, wood.
Taste: starts rather fruity and with hints of wood, then finishes nice and sour. 
I had this beer multiple times, also had Batch 1, in my memory that was a rather superior beer. Afterwards I had Batch 2 rather fresh, which was a little to fruity and not sour enough in my opinion. But now I had the second batch again, but with some maturation, it improved a lot in taste and the sourness came in great again.
So little advice for everybody buying this beer, keep it cellared for one year, maybe little more, and the beer will be a lot better!

Bottle from Dany that I took to Andys place.  Pours a hazed ruby amber with a thin to medium sized white head.  Big juicy cherries on the nose, raspberries and a hint of caramel.  Medium bodied, sweet and tangy.  Lots of chewy berries and cherry flesh. Tangy fruit and a hint of sourness.  Absolutely lovely.  Easy drinking.

Bottled from Biernavigatie.nl. Ruby colored, beautiful mostly lasting head. Extremely fruity nose, cherries, raspberries, marzipan, a little bit of "Haribo" candy, but that disappears as soon as the beer warms up. Very sour flavor, but enough other flavors to back it up, fruity sweetness, malts, the Flemish Sour character clearly shines though. Full mouthfeel. Pretty extreme, but still wonderfully balanced. Absolutely fantastic brew.
@zbf13. A very interesting beer. Dark red colour. Tart, cherries, sour, oak, sweet but not too sweet.

Bottiglia 75cl @ Zythos biere festival
Rosata sul fucsia, poca schiuma.
Veramente ottima, ciliegia molto presente.

Very very nice beer. One of the pleasant surprises of ZBF13.
Very enjoyable if you are into sour ales. Thanks to yiannos, I have one bottle to age back home.

Un nez fougueusement rouge.  Des parfums vibrants de cerises, de framboises et de petites baies sauvages et terreuses.  Une base maltée complémentaire qui va jusquà émettre des vibrations caramélisées et même chocolatées.  Des ardeurs boisées et du cuir mouillé.  Superbe.  Une bouche déjà conquise après la première gorgée.  Un savoir-faire intensément fruité qui permet de belles envolées surettes et acides.  Une élégante touche de vinaigre de vin rouge et de vinaigre de framboises.  Une large embrassade du tonneau de chêne.  Un caractère caramélisé qui napporte que léquilibre nécessaire.  Une bouche qui montre un corps huileux.  Un pétillement qui traverse plusieurs phases dintensité.  Une finale fruitée, propre, vivifiante et franche.  Une bière incroyablement facile à boire qui présente un fabuleux profil aromatique.  Ceci dit, dans son intégralité, cette rouge est simplement fantastique.
Bottle- Nose is sweet fruits,tart,cherry,oak..Taste is amazing sweet fruits,sugar, bugs,cranberry,sour,pear..Palate is sweet, sour , dry

Bouteille de 750ml avec bouchon de liège, sans étiquette, plutôt une corde de poche avec une étiquette en carton. Liquide rouge qui ne mousse pas. Le nez est sur les fruits rouges, acide, suret, cerises, agréable. Un peu de pastille Vicks au nez. La bouche est acide, surette tout en fruit et en levure sauvage. Finale sur la pastille mais combien agréable. Une Rodenbach à son meilleure. Un préjugé favorable aux bières de Rodenbach ne peut que me séduire. Superbe.

Bottle @ WWT II. Pours red/pink with a very small fading white head. Aroma is sour cherries, red fruits and a lot of sour and tart notes, some oak. Taste is sour cherries, raspberries, quite sour and tart. Dry and lasting finish with a really nice astringency. Good stuff.

Bottle @ WWT II. Pours a clear pinkish coloured beer with a very small off white thin head that dissappears quickly. Aroma is flowery, bretty and fruity, with characters of cherries and raspberries. Defintely some oak in the aroma as well. Flavour is very well balanced combination between sour and tart influences of the Brett and a sweet fruity note. Very dry finish that last not as lang as Ive hoped. Very decent brew!!

75cl Bottle at WWT II. Slightly hazy ruby brown colour, off-white head. Aroma of sour cherries, cherry skin, berries, hint of acetone. Flavour is sour cherries at first, raspberries, hint of acetone, some brown sugar, tart cherry finish, wood. Light to medium-bodied. Nice.

Sample at wwt 2 tasting.
Thin white head.  Clear red pour.  Smooth beer with a slightly sour taste.

Bottle thanks to KingCecil.  Pours a deep dark red with a medium off-white head.  Strong berry aroma with the raspberries most prominent, followed by the cherries with the cranberries coming through as well.  Some nice acidity and light funk as well.  Taste is medium sweet, very fruity, and mild-medium sour.  Finish is very lightly sour, very clean.  Light bodied, well carbonated, super refreshing.  Beautiful, wish I had more.

UPDATED: MAR 27, 2013 bottle.  tons of big blackberries, raspberries, cocoaed cherries.   potent big sweet jammy fruits.    pleasant soured cranberry.   5/10 on the sourness scale.   fruit forward for sure.   pretty nice.   reminiscent of new glarus fruit beers with all dem fruits, but this is more sour.   liked it.

750 thanks to Dylan! Pours a deep ruby red color, very bright, with a medium fluffy white head. A huge nose of raspberries, sugars, tart wood. The flavor was unexpected and interesting: very quaffable brew, woody, tannins, light sourness, big sweet natural fruit, very smooth. Great brew. I could drink a ton.

750ml bottle shared by Doug, thanks 
Appearance: Clear red/golden with a small off-white head and some lacing 
Aroma: Sweet cherries and fruity, light malts 
Taste: Tart cherries, sugar with a dry finish 
Nice, tart

Ruby-copper, clear, off-white head with pinkish hue. Aroma of dry crackerlike malt, cherries, light sourness and some sugary sweetness.  Flavor is lightly sour with a complex berry profile, a little back-sweetened sugar note. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Poured from a 750ml bottle, thanks to Doug. The fruit is a big part of this beer. Solid tartness, malty, sweet. Very enjoyable.

(75 cl bottle from Toft Vin; 2nd batch) Pours a clear, ruby amber with medium, tan head. Beatuiful lace and decent retention. Very sparkling. Aroma is fruity with dominant notes of cherry with a slightly tart accent. Oily texture, medium body and a tart finish. Taste has a degree of sweetness that balances the tartness well. Very pleasant and drinkable for the style. Girlfriend says: "Its like a really ripe black cherry."

Bottle at Hunahpus Day 2013 (Tampa, FL). Pours a rich deep ruby copper hue, gentle haze, lively carbonation, great deep glow and frothy offwhite head laces well, sticks around. Aromas are sour cherries, oak, gentle red wine. Muted, lactic, touch balsamic, gentle bready malts. Oaky. Initial is lighter end of medium bodied, some good cherry and oak character, gentle red wine, balsamic, toast, and gentle sweetness. Vanilla tannins, red wine, more muted but in perfect balance. Middle is a touch sweet, oak and vanilla, sourness is firm but never overwhelming, preaching balance and blend prowess. Nice flavors, cherries and oak, some red wine, and gentle toastiness. Vanilla, lactic yogurty feel is mellow. This is an accomplishment as far as balance. Damn nice. Gorgeous pour.

bottle shared by jean-michaël, thanks! pours hazy red-pink with a low white cap, little retention. tons of red fruits - actually, i can taste the three different fruits in there, and they still blend in together, raspberry jam, also mint, few phenols - coming from fruits and not an off-flavour here. very lightly toasted and caramelized cereals, vinous characteristics - light acidity - just the right amount - pepper and other spices from the oak, very dusty yeast. lively and soft carbonation, light body, nice herbal-citrusy-lightly acidic finish. very nice!

Bottle from Etre Gourmet. Pours cloudy red lilac with a small pinkish diminishing head. Aroma is red berries, sweet, acidy, very fresh; devine. Flavor is sour  a bit tart, very berry, fruity, so refreshing. Fantastic session beer, so good.

This beer has a deep red colour with a reduced limited foam-head.  Great balanced fruity taste with  acids that are in balance. The full fruity taste is long lasting on the pallet there is no hop taste but a refreshing aftertaste and complex alcohols .

---Rated By the Belleketels

What a good way to start the weekend, a fine drink while waiting for invitees to show up. Pours clear red, fruit juice like really. Head doesnt linger for too long and lacing is minimal. Nose is really nice, with red fruits, balsamic notes and a hint of sour. Taste is not quite sour to the point of being puckering but it is enough to make it highly drinkable and refreshing. Flavors are again like a fine balsamic vinegar mixed with some organic fruit juice. This is really, really good to me. This pretty much settles the war between Rodenbach and Verhaeghe in my cellar, Rodenbach FTW! This is WAY better than the Echt Kriekenber and even than the Duchesse too. Ill need to stock up on these I guess!

Bottled. Pours hazy amber with virtually no head. Aroma of red berries especially cherries and vinegar. Sweet/sour flavor with fruity elemrnts, that ends up more tart. Medium bodied, watery to oily texture and soft CO2. A very nice and crisp sour. ★★★★
Drunk with Dom and Dan. Totally delicious. Like a smoother less sick tasting version of their Gand Cru, yet oddly not quite as good. I need to rerate that. Big cheers to Richie btw
Nothing on the bottle, not even a whisper. Lights survived this one as well. Cherry cough sweets, light and airy. Good, but the company it was in last night was challenging.
UPDATED: FEB 16, 2013 Bottle from the_bish. Superbly easy to drink. Sweet cherry, raspberry. Thin in mouth. Light. Really good.

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2015 Beautiful beer all round. Look is light reddish pink, which makes complete sense when you taste the raspbeery sweetness coming off the brew. Taste is light sour with bright berry flavour. Very refreshing and fun. Nice finish - sherbert-esque. Great beer all round. Refreshing and tasty.
Bottle 75 cl. Courtesy of Jookos. Pours nice reddish copper with small head and a great scent of berries. Taste is cherries, berries, sweetness and marzipan.

@ Basunen. Fantastisk fin, rödlig färg. Doften kommer på en gång och är tydlig fruktig med störst toner av jordgubb. Smaken har en fin och sammetslen syrlighet, känner även den karakteristiska sötman från de vanliga Rodenbach men även en tydlig fatton. Mycket gott!

Sweet fruits, cranberry, strawberries, raspberries, cherries, light funk, oak, sweet tarts, and licorice in the aroma. Very juicy, tart, oaky, tart cranberry, sweet cherry flavor. Not super complex and not as good as some Rodenbach but a good beer.

Pour out of 750 mL bottle, huge, huge thanks to Dave for the pour! Dark reddish pour with thin white head, aroma brought notes of big raspberry, tart cranberry, hints of cherry, blackberry, hints of nice lemon, lactic and vanilla notes, nice tart lemon, wow this is nice.  Taste is a mix of raspberry, nice cherry, hints of lemon, lactic notes, slight horseblanket, lots of cranberry, lingonberry, nice basement, finishing sweet, but slightly tart hints of earthy tart fruit.  I want more of this.

Bottled. Pours reddish in color with some bubbles. Cherries, some sweetness, berries as blackcurrants. Some marzipan too. A bit like some wilberries hand-picked is the taste made of. A bit of them berries in the finish as well.
0.75 bottle. Dark copper, some haze. Dark berry nose. Dark cherries, dark currants, funk, some malts. Body is lightish, sour berries. Very enjoyable.-- beerbasher/N9

18-JAN-2012, bottle @ulkløbben meeting, @Henrik.
Red, clear, no head.
Sweet raspberry aroma. Taste is sweet with a touch of tartness. Fresh, not really funky, some tart cherries. Medium to soft carbonation. Really too sweet. Simple. Disappointed.

What an aroma! Sweet cranberries, strawberries and well berries. Good body on it. Nice tartness, though a tad artificial tasting. More berries. Effervescent. A bit of time on this could bump it up to classic status. Great flemish red.
750ml bottle-Thanks PaulUnwin-white ring-red.  A-raspberry, malty, some spice.  T-sweet raspberry, turns tart quickly, acidic, malty. some spice hops.

Bottle (75 cl) from bieresgourmet.be. Clear reddish brown, medium beige head. Fruity red berries aroma with apples, cider, vinegar and wood. Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Semi sweet with soft acidity.
